if you long for flavor and quality, but you’re also a savvy, budget-conscious connoisseur, quorum is a perfect companion to invite into your humidor. relieve any shame for being thrifty by sticking to your guns when it comes to getting the rich and satisfying experience often reserved for uber-pricey cigars. handmade in nicaragua by j.c. newman cigar company, quorum shade offers a medium-bodied profile of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos under a blond ecuador connecticut wrapper. a sharp burn with smooth notes of buttered toast, white pepper and cream have made quorum a best-seller for years. savor our everyday low prices on quorum, we guarantee you’ll be back for more!

a delicious core of handcrafted nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos are well-dressed in an oily maduro wrapper to deliver a medium-bodied profile with rich flavor and aroma. dark chocolate, coffee beans and notes of dried fruit display a silky texture with a leathery room note. fans of maduro wrappers can add a savory everyday value to their collections with a pleasantly balanced bundle in a nice array of sought-after sizes from quorum.

satisfy your quota for great bargains by picking up bundles of the quorum brand. made for the folks at j.c. newman, quorum is comprised of a glistening ecuador sumatra wrapper over a tasty amalgam of all-nicaraguan tobaccos. a tasty, handcrafted, medium-bodied profile of coffee and spices delights the palate at anytime of the day in a classic variety of shapes.

secret recipes from the cookbook of legendary cigar-maker rolando reyes sr., aka roly, live on in the hands of his grandson, carlos diez, who ensures his grandfather’s legacy is honored in puros indios vintage cigars. although roly passed away in 2012, his passion and dedication to making premium cigars distinguish puros indios among the most popular honduran cigars. roly began making cigars in cuba at the age of nine but went on to impart a lifetime of knowledge in blending some of the greatest honduran brands of the past thirty years. puros indios vintage is crafted from the company’s oldest tobacco reserves to achieve an ultra-refined taste. a glistening, gingerbread-hued ecuador wrapper envelops a hearty blend of dominican, nicaraguan, and brazilian long-fillers concealed in a smooth and succulent binder cultivated in ecuador. toasty and woody notes of cedar, hickory, and leather coat the palate with peppery texture while abundant aroma fills the room. indulge in an old-school honduran brand for pennies on the dollar by procuring the last boxes of puros indios vintage for your coolerdor today!

punch vintage is an exceptional, super-premium blend handcrafted in honduras and widely sought after by connoisseurs of fine cigars. what really sets apart punch vintage from the rest of the punch franchise is the fact that they are aged in specially designed cedar cabinets for over a year before they are shipped out. punch vintage is available in a cocoa-hued ecuador (natural) wrapper or an oily connecticut broadleaf (maduro). inside, a distinct blend of dominican and honduran long-fillers are tucked alongside high-grade connecticut broadleaf binders for an added dose of earthy sweetness. notes of cocoa, leather, coffee and wood provide a rich profile of cedar and spices throughout the resonant finish. introduce a delicious cigar into your humidor with and enjoy immediate savings on the iconic punch brand.

the punch brand goes back well over one hundred years in the cigar business. get a taste of the punch legacy with signature. a medium to full-bodied profile of caramel, beans and leather with a fiery charred character offers a complex, spicy finish. punch signature is handcrafted in honduras from a sound combination of nicaraguan and dominican long-filler tobaccos tucked under a succulent corojo wrapper.

punch rare corojo is the #1 fastest-selling punch cigar ever to hit the streets. cigar aficionados eagerly await the annual release of punch rare corojo every year, which is only available for a limited time. full-flavored, spicy notes of nutmeg and cedar are perfectly presented in a balanced blend of nicaraguan and honduran tobaccos with a rich connecticut broadleaf binder under a sumptuous, mahogany-hued corojo wrapper. purchase punch rare corojo while supplies last!

featuring a blend similar to the regular line, punch grand cru distinguishes itself by enjoying an extensive aging-period before being shipped to cigar stores nationwide. the 3-5 year rest brings out a smooth sweetness inherent to the tobacco and tempers some of the rougher edges. very earthy and showcasing a smoothly-escalating spice, punch grand cru is a deceptively strong cigar; yet so smooth you don’t even realize the strength.

punch gran puro nicaragua is handcrafted from a rich combination of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos beneath a chocolate-hued connecticut broadleaf wrapper. medium to full-bodied notes of earthy spices envelop the palate in a cascade of dynamic flavors. taste a satisfying nicaraguan profile from a storied, cuban-legacy brand with a sweet, emergent complexity.

punch gran puro shows us what honduran tobacco is all about. composed entirely of honduran-grown tobaccos, punch gran puro is a satisfying (but not overwhelming) medium to full-bodied cigar with just the right amount of black pepper on the finish. the sungrown honduran wrapper provides a vibrant appearance and readily offers up rich, earthy flavors along with pleasant notes of cedar, oak and leather.

legendary cuban legacy brand punch pulls out the stops with the zesty, full-bodied profile of punch diablo, blended by aj fernandez. a dark and earthy ecuador sumatra wrapper harbors a meaty core of connecticut broadleaf binders with nicaraguan and honduran long-fillers in a peppery and piquant blend loaded with notes of hickory, leather, and spicy fireplace-like aromas. punch diablo is handmade in estelí, nicaragua. a handful of beefy formats deliver a cool-burning smoke with a bold and feisty finish. pump punch diablo into your rotation when you’re craving a stronger, after-dinner smoke that’s best enjoyed at a measured pace.

the world famous punch brand has been made in honduras since 1969 from cuban-seed tobaccos grown in honduras, nicaragua and the dominican republic. they offer a magnificent, easy smoke with a full bodied taste using sumatra seed, ecuadorian grown natural wrappers and connecticut broadleaf for the maduro shapes.

punch is a medium to full-bodied cigar rolled in honduras. featuring a diverse blend of dominican, honduran and nicaraguan long-fillers, punch is available in a natural wrapper from ecuador, or a connecticut broadleaf maduro wrapper. the natural adds a heavy, peppery spice to an earthy profile, while the maduro (and double maduro when available) adds extra sweetness with full-flavored notes of dark chocolate, hickory and black pepper. well-blended and rolled to perfection, punch has been a staple for fans of smooth, medium-bodied cigars for decades.

plasencia reserva original is an authentic organic cigar. in the early 2000s, nestor plasencia jr. began growing organic tobacco crops on select farms and produced a cigar called reserva organica for a few years. today, plasencia reserva original is blended from the same tobacco crops, certified organic according to organic crop improvement association (ocia) standards. the plasencias grow the binder, filler, and wrapper tobaccos for reserva original one-hundred percent free of any pesticides and insecticides on their nicaraguan farms. tasting notes of earth, vanilla, cereal, and turkish spices culminate in a sweet and unusual finish. savor a mild to medium-bodied organic smoke from the plasencia family in a collection of traditional sizes.

plasencia alma del fuego is a 93-rated cigar blended by nestor andrés plasencia and ranked in cigar aficionado’s ‘top 25’ in 2019. alma del fuego is drawn from a complex blend of premium long-fillers grown in jalapa and the volcanic soils of nicaragua’s ometepe island, where a pair of volcanoes, concepción and maderas, contribute to the crops’ profound richness. the plasencia family ages its ometepe tobaccos for seven years to achieve optimal smoothness, and alma del fuego is finished in an oily, reddish-brown nicaraguan wrapper leaf from jalapa. notes of coffee bean, clove, pepper, and espresso layer the palate before a nutty finale leaves a touch of sweetness in its wake.

better known as the cigar-makers behind dozens of releases from rocky patel, romeo y julieta, and alec bradley, the plasencia family debuted their eponymous brand a few years back, and alma del campo is a solid introduction to what the plasencias do best. a lustrous, chocolate-brown nicaraguan criollo wrapper harbors a well-aged interior of premium nicaraguan long-fillers in a collection of balanced sizes. a woody and peppery profile of cedar, dark cocoa, leather, and earth culminates in a floral finish with hints of fresh bread.

plasencia 1865 alma fuerte is a small-batch cigar blended and handcrafted in estelí, nicaragua, by the plasencia family, who’ve been growing tobacco and producing cigars for many of the biggest brands in the industry for decades. five generations of premium cigar-making culminates in the 93-rated 1865 alma fuerte which ranked in cigar aficionado’s ‘top 10’ in 2017. an intricate core of nicaraguan long-fillers from estelí, condega, jalapa, and ometepe is bound by a hearty criollo wrapper leaf in a well-made and balanced collection. bold notes of leather, cocoa, earth, and toast complement a robust spice from beginning to end. alma fuerte translates to “strong soul,” and you can taste the plasencia family’s determination to grow, age, and blend their finest tobaccos in a rich, cohesive masterpiece.

perla del mar shade cigars deliver mellow, easygoing taste for a decent value in a couple of classic shapes. the vintage cuban-heritage brand was resurrected by j.c. newman with a succulent four-region blend of nicaraguan tobaccos tucked under a savory ecuador connecticut wrapper. a pleasant profile of nuts, wheat, and spices layers the palate before a creamy and smooth finish resonates. add an old-world brand handmade in nicaragua to your collection today.

as a dedicated cigar-maker who loves to provide the best quality for the most reasonable prices, nick perdomo has honed his skills with a signature of medium to full-bodied nicaraguan blends. sun grown nicaraguan wrappers enrobe a complex medley of nicaraguan long-fillers in the perdomo small batch sun grown. toasted notes of almonds, wood, spices and coffee deliver a complex and balanced finish.

nick perdomo has become a hero to value-obsessed connoisseurs with releases such as perdomo small batch maduro. a sweet and spicy nicaraguan maduro wrapper rests over well-aged, all-nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos with maximum flavor. a full-bodied profile of white pepper and leather delivers a complex and earthy finish with perfect construction and a full-flavored draw.

perdomo small batch connecticut offers the brand’s trusted blend of value and flavor with an aged blend of nicaraguan long-fillers beneath a silky ecuador connecticut wrapper. a mild to medium-bodied profile of sweet spices delivers a hint of vanilla and caramel with an approachable finish. consistent construction and quality are the result of nick perdomo’s attention to detail in the manufacture of every cigar in his immaculate factory in nicaragua.

perdomo lot 23 maduro cigars are named for nick perdomo’s lot 23 farm in nicaragua, a special estate he developed with his father, nick sr., in 2000. all the tobaccos sourced for lot 23 cigars are grown there, including the maduro’s dark and oily cuban-seed wrapper leaf. the tobaccos are aged for a minimum of five years before they’re handcrafted to nick’s meticulous standards for taste and consistency. a medium-bodied profile of dark cocoa, coffee bean, cedar, and oak culminates with woody and hearty aroma in a collection of classic sizes. put perdomo lot 23 maduro in your humidor when you’re looking for reliable value cigar finished in a decadent wrapper. lot 23 cigars from perdomo exceed expectations without breaking the bank.

the perdomo lot 23 series underscores nick perdomo’s immense commitment to creating top-quality cigars for a fair price. nick developed lot 23 with his father, nick sr., over two decades ago when they began planting a select crop of tobaccos on a single farm in estelí, nicaragua, destined for a trio of lot 23 blends, each finished in a distinctive wrapper leaf. lot 23 connecticut is the mildest of the bunch with an elegant profile of cedar, almonds, and fresh coffee while hints of honey and spices layer the palate with luscious texture. a golden-blond ecuador connecticut wrapper conceals a special blend of cuban-seed long-fillers aged for a minimum of five years. explore a valued-priced gem from perdomo in five popular and slightly thicker shapes.

perdomo lot 23 is blended in unique fashion; employing a rich assortment of tobaccos all harvested from one single plantation. all of the tobaccos used to create lot 23 are grown on one farm in estelí, nicaragua and aged for 6 full years prior to rolling. medium-bodied in strength, these beauties boast buttery-brown corojo wrappers and a pleasant array of sweet and spicy flavors. notes of nuts and cedar swim hand in hand with a satisfying earthy richness.

perdomo limited edition cameroon is created with grade 'a' cameroon wrappers that have been aging for over a decade. this exceptional cache of sweet and mellow cameroon leaf glistens with oil and is as smooth as silk. a rich, medium-bodied and well-aged filler blend is utilized to counterbalance the wrapper's natural earthy sweetness. available only in a petit corona size, while supplies last.

perdomo inmenso seventy sun grown boasts a bursting blend of premium nicaraguan long-fillers, aged for five years, beneath a cuban-seed sun grown nicaraguan wrapper. tasting notes of cedar, earth, and spice caress the palate in voluptuous clouds of creamy, indulgent smoke. the chunky shape of inmenso burns cool and slow before a medium-bodied finish blesses the senses for an awesome value. join the big ring gauge fanatics, and add an oversized premium handmade from perdomo to your collection today.

perdomo inmenso seventy maduro boasts big flavor and aroma in a chunky collection of shapes. a trio of oversized 70-ring masterpieces are handmade from a thick core of premium nicaraguan tobaccos blended to perfection beneath an oily nicaraguan maduro wrapper. tasting notes of dark cocoa, espresso, and wood harmonize in a medium to full-bodied profile. inmenso delivers creamy and earthy flavor in a sequence of big, cool-burning draws from beginning to end. indulge in one of nick perdomo’s biggest hits to date.

perdomo habano sun grown cigars, also called perdomo habano bourbon barrel-aged sun grown, consist of cuban-seed nicaraguan tobaccos aged for a minimum of six years. an oily nicaraguan wrapper leaf is grown under direct sunlight and rests for several additional months in an old bourbon barrel to achieve a mouthwatering balance of sweet and spicy taste. notes of smoked almond, oak, cedar, and cayenne come into play before a big tangy finish arrives. smoke a classic, medium-bodied profile blended by brand founder nick perdomo in a chunky collection of sizes adored by cigar lovers everywhere. perdomo cigars are handcrafted in estelí, nicaragua, to an uncompromising standard for flavor, construction, and value.

perdomo habano maduro cigars, also referred to as perdomo habano bourbon barrel-aged maduro, are blended by brand founder nick perdomo from a signature recipe of premium cuban-seed nicaraguan long-fillers aged for a minimum of six years, including a dark and toothy nicaraguan wrapper leaf. in a finishing step, every wrapper leaf rests in a bourbon barrel for several months to attain an unusually sweet and voluptuous taste. savor a medium to full-bodied profile of dark chocolate, roasted coffee bean, earth, and leather punctuated by a plethora of chewy spices in a popular collection of thick sizes. aficionados love perdomo cigars for their meticulous consistency and value.

perdomo habano connecticut cigars, also called perdomo habano bourbon barrel-aged connecticut, are drawn from a vintage blend of premium nicaraguan long-fillers tucked under a deep-blond ecuador connecticut wrapper. every leaf of tobacco is aged for a minimum of six years, while the wrapper leaf receives an additional maturation in an old bourbon barrel for an enhanced sweetness and complexity. tasting notes of cedar, white pepper, and blonde roast coffee bean mingle before a resplendently creamy finish layers the palate in a collection of classic perdomo sizes. perdomo habano connecticut delivers a mild to medium-bodied, buttery, and smooth profile from beginning to end. value, consistency, and taste reign supreme in perdomo cigars.

data.cigar_name: perdomo estate seleccion vintage sun grown
data.cigar_description: perdomo estate seleccion vintage sun grown arrives courtesy of master cigar blender, nick perdomo. caramel-hued nicaraguan sun grown wrappers hug a well-aged amalgam of nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos. a medium-bodied profile reveals distinct flavors of oak, pepper and coffee with plenty of zest and great balance. treat yourself to the exhilarating aromas and consistency perdomo estate seleccion vintage sun grown offers today.

nick perdomo knows how to hit the sweet spot when it comes to aging tobacco to a glowing standard. perdomo estate seleccion vintage maduro features a dark chocolate nicaraguan maduro wrapper over a premium blend of nicaraguan long-fillers patiently paired in nick’s impressive factory in estelí, nicaragua. tantalizing flavors of cocoa, cedar, coffee and spice marry in a medium to full-bodied profile. enjoy the complex aromas and superior construction of perdomo estate seleccion vintage maduro today.

perdomo estate seleccion vintage connecticut hails from the immaculate factory of nick perdomo in estelí, nicaragua. beautiful blond ecuador connecticut wrappers encompass an exquisite combination of premium nicaraguan long-fillers. extensive aging of perdomo’s finest tobaccos reveals rich notes of caramel, cedar and cream in a variety of classic formats. enjoy the succulent finish and mild profile of perdomo estate seleccion vintage connecticut today.

data.cigar_name: perdomo double aged vintage sun grown
data.cigar_description: perdomo double aged vintage sun grown is made from premium nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos beneath a sun grown nicaraguan wrapper, all of which have been matured for 12 years. the final 2 years of the aging process take place in white oak bourbon barrels to achieve the perfect color, texture and flavor. a medium-bodied profile of oak, nuts, cedar and cocoa leads to a full-flavored finish with a distinctive note of bourbon and an inviting room note.

as a master cigar blender, nick perdomo knows how to combine premium tobaccos as well as value and consistency with superb results. the double aged vintage maduro features a hearty nicaraguan wrapper over a flavorful amalgam of long-filler tobaccos, all of which have been aged for 12 years, including 2 years in white oak bourbon barrels. notes of dark chocolate, coffee and sweet spices deliver a medium to full-bodied profile with optimal texture, aroma and flavor.

enjoy a limited release from nick perdomo with the double aged vintage connecticut. blond ecuador connecticut wrappers conceal a stellar combination of nicaraguan long-fillers, all of which go through a lengthy double-aging process, including two years inside white oak bourbon barrels to ensure an extra dose of distinctive flavor. notes of caramel, butter and cedar deliver a rich and refined finish with a balanced, medium-bodied profile.

perdomo 20th anniversary sun grown is one of nick perdomo's  best  creations yet.  grown solely on perdomo's most prominent farms in  esteli, condega and the legendary jalapa valley in nicaragua these  remarkable cigars are brought to life using only the highest priming  tobaccos from each of these regions.  medium to full-bodied in strength  perdomo 20th anniversary sun grown boasts an incredible richness and a  slight spice as well as a diverse flavor profile including notes of  cocoa, cream and a touch of sweet grass.

perdomo 20th anniversary maduro is guaranteed to deliver another  all-star to nick's already stellar lineup of affordable high-quality  premium cigars.  for this project nick decided to use only the highest  priming tobaccos from his finest farms in esteli, condega and the  renowned jalapa valley in nicaragua.  perdomo 20th anniversary maduro is  medium to full-bodied and unbelievably complex, delivering flavors of  coffee, earth, leather and the perfect amount of spice leaving the  palate in a state of pure joy.

add a tasteful cigar from nick perdomo’s all-star portfolio to your humidor with perdomo 20th anniversary connecticut. golden-blond ecuador connecticut wrappers envelop the highest priming tobaccos from nick’s farms in estelî, condega, and the legendary jalapa valley in nicaragua. flavors of cream, pepper and cedar combine in a mild to medium-bodied profile. enjoy complex aromas and approachable balance from a value-priced cigar with great construction and an elegant finish.

perdomo 10th anniversary cigars have been the bestselling series in the perdomo portfolio for years. perdomo 10th anniversary sun grown is a gorgeous addition to a popular trilogy, which includes connecticut-seed and maduro-wrapped blends. the sun grown edition features an oily, reddish-brown nicaraguan wrapper leaf aged for six years, plus ten months in a bourbon barrel. beneath it lies a meaty blend of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos grown on select perdomo estates. 10th anniversary sun grown delivers magnificent notes of smoked almonds, wood, leather, and spices in a well-made collection of attractive shapes. add perdomo 10th anniversary sun grown to your rotation and indulge in a luscious medium to full-bodied profile for a superb value.

perdomo 10th anniversary maduro cigars are drafted from an impressive blend of premium cuban-seed nicaraguan tobaccos grown on select perdomo estates. rich and earthy long-filler tobaccos aged for six years lie beneath a dark and lustrous nicaraguan maduro wrapper matured for an additional fourteen months in a bourbon barrel. tasting notes of dark chocolate, espresso, hickory, and black pepper mingle before a savory finish arrives. choose your favorite formats from a collection of traditional big ring gauge cigars. perdomo 10th anniversary maduro delivers an excellent profile for an amazing price.

perdomo 10th anniversary champagne is a wonderful cigar for a great value. handmade in nicaragua, these cigars feature a beautiful, silky connecticut-seed wrapper along with a rich, flavorful blend of all-nicaraguan long-fillers. the strength is medium-bodied, while the flavors are rich and earthy touched by hints of coffee and cream. the finish is smooth, nutty and satisfying.

a dark, connecticut broadleaf wrapper and some additional nicaraguan fillers transforms the classic partagas into partagas black; a full-bodied, spice-laden smoke bomb. heavy flavors of earth, espresso and anise lurk in the cloud of smoke produced by partagas black and entice only the strongest of smokers.

partagas is a storied name in the tomes of cigar lore. rolled in the dominican republic, partagas features a combination of dominican and mexican fillers with a sweet cameroon wrapper. medium-bodied with a mild sweetness, these cigars offer light flavors of earth and nuts along with a hint of spice.

originally created for the european market, paradiso now has limited  distribution in the u.s. as well. handcrafted in nicaragua, paradiso  showcases the marvelous blending ability of pepin garcia combined with  ashton's infinite commitment to quality. purely nicaraguan in  composition, paradiso offers profound complexity in every puff. bold  earthy and cedary flavors swim hand in hand with subtle, creamier  flavors while a peppery spice and dark chocolaty sweetness alternate on  the backend.

par is the ultimate yard ‘gar for ultra-frugal golfers. you don’t have to spend a fortune or dip into your savings when you need basic cigars to puff on while you’re knocking the golf ball around, or mowing the grass for that matter. par delivers respectable taste and a reliable burn for a super-cheap price per cigar when you pick up a tasty 20-count bundle. a smooth and creamy blend of premium dominican sandwich tobaccos is finished in a silky, golden-blond connecticut shade wrapper in a handful of consistent sizes. mellow notes of coffee with cream, nuts, and spices layer the palate without zapping your bank account. add a budget-friendly bundle to your daily smoking rotating when you put par in the cart today!

padrón family reserve cigars comprise an elite collection. exclusive reserves of premium nicaraguan tobaccos, matured for a decade or longer, go into this top-rated, small-batch series. each size commemorates a special milestone in the company’s history, and each is handmade by a master cigar-maker in either a natural or a maduro wrapper leaf. complex and perfectly refined notes of dark cocoa, coffee bean, cedar, nutmeg, nuts, and leather weave a sweet and spicy tapestry over the palate. in 2009, the critics in cigar aficionado rated the padrón family reserve no. 45 maduro 95 points and crowned it the ‘#1 cigar of the year.’ every size in this stunning collection is handcrafted to the same uncompromising criteria for consistency, flavor, and aroma. savor the pinnacle of premium nicaraguan taste with padrón family reserve today.

padrón dámaso cigars are finished in a golden-blond ecuador connecticut wrapper leaf in a collection of round sizes, as opposed to the brand’s iconic box-pressed shapes. this mild to medium-bodied profile is blended from nicaraguan long-fillers on the inside and imparts notes of cedar, pepper, cashew, and cocoa with hints of coconut before a long and creamy finish. the line is named for dámaso padrón, the first padrón family member to arrive in cuba from the canary islands in the 1800s. his legacy in premium tobacco continues thanks to the hard work and passion of brand founder josé orlando padrón and his son, jorge padrón. savor a mellow 93-rated classic when you add padrón dámaso to your collection today.

padrón 80 years is an impressive perfecto drawn from special reserves of the finest tobaccos assembled by a master cigar roller to the highest standards for consistency, flavor, and aroma. padrón 80 years cigars are finished in a gorgeous nicaraguan wrapper in either a natural or maduro leaf. the maduro is rated 96 points by the critics in cigar aficionado, who also ranked this rare 6.75-by-54 box-pressed perfecto the ‘#2 cigar of the year’ in 2008. vintage nicaraguan long-fillers are aged several years to achieve optimal smoothness in an intricate profile of dark cocoa, pepper, nougat, almond, and coffee bean, punctuated by notes of cayenne and cinnamon. padrón 80 years was blended in honor of the eightieth birthday of legendary cigar-maker and brand founder josé orlando padrón. savor a stellar small-batch classic, considered among the finest nicaraguan cigars in the world.

the padrón 50th anniversary is an incredibly rare 6.5-by-52 box-pressed toro blended in honor of the brand’s fiftieth anniversary. originally, this exquisite smoke was only available in a limited run of 1,000 immaculate humidors, made by hand, each containing 50 cigars. though still made in the smallest of batches, the padrón 50th anniversary cigar is available at select retailers today. a gorgeous nicaraguan wrapper leaf, either a natural or a maduro, embraces nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos drawn from the company’s oldest reserves of tobaccos, aged for more than ten years. cocoa, leather, cedar, almond, nougat, and pepper weave an elaborate profile over the palate with incredibly seductive aroma. savor this 94-rated gem from padrón on your next special occasion.

the padrón 40th anniversary is a meticulously handmade 6.5-by-54 box-pressed torpedo that bears the distinction of being named cigar aficionado’s very first ‘#1 cigar of the year’ in 2004, the year the critics launched their annual ‘top 25 cigars of the year.’ twenty years later, padrón cigars have scored no less than four ‘cigar of the year’ titles with dozens of showings in the ‘top 10’ and many of the highest ratings in the cigar industry. the padrón 40th anniversary, blended to commemorate the brand’s fortieth anniversary, is a special occasion cigar worthy of any connoisseur’s collection. vintage nicaraguan long-fillers, matured for several years, lie beneath an oily natural wrapper leaf or a toothy maduro in a sharp, box-pressed shape that concentrates the flavor delightfully. relish an uncompromising profile of cocoa powder, cayenne, cinnamon, cedar, nuts, and coffee bean before a long and luscious finish blesses the palate.

padrón 1964 anniversary cigars are handcrafted from the finest nicaraguan tobaccos in a prestigious collection of box-pressed sizes. in 2021, the critics in cigar aficionado rated the padrón 1964 anniversary blend 97 points and crowned it the ‘#1 cigar of the year,’ the fourth time they’ve bestowed the honor on the award-winning padrón portfolio. padrón 1964 anniversary cigars are drawn from premium nicaraguan long-fillers finished in your choice of a natural or a maduro wrapper. every leaf of tobacco in padrón 1964 anniversary cigars is aged for several years to achieve optimal smoothness from the first puff to the last. savor an exquisite profile of cedar, cocoa powder, leather, nuts, and coffee bean with hints of cinnamon and cayenne. the maduro wrapper imparts a darker, sweeter finish. add one of the most sought-after nicaraguan cigars to your collection from the world-renowned padrón brand today.

padrón no. 90 cigars were blended and named in honor of the ninetieth birthday of brand founder and legendary cigar-maker josé orlando padrón. part of the 1926 series, no. 90 cigars represent a small-batch release from this iconic brand, and they’ve received impressive accolades over the years, including a 94-point rating with a ranking in the ‘top 5 cigars of the year’ by the critics in cigar aficionado. savor a refined profile of cedar, cocoa, coffee bean, dark chocolate, nuts, spices, and more. the no. 90 is handcrafted in an exquisite 5.5-by-52 round size packaged in a gorgeous tube, perfect for gifting to a cigar lover. padrón no. 90 cigars are available in natural or maduro wrappers, and all of the tobaccos are aged for several years to achieve an unrivaled flavor and aroma.

padrón 1926 series cigars are handcrafted by master cigar rollers in estelí, nicaragua, from the finest tobaccos in a collection of meticulously box-pressed sizes. padrón 1926 series cigars have received some of the highest ratings from the critics in cigar aficionado, including a 97-point score and ‘#1 cigar of the year’ honors in 2007, as well as numerous rankings in the ‘top 10.’ the padrón 1926 series is available in a glistening natural nicaraguan wrapper leaf or a dark and toothy nicaraguan maduro. inside each wrapper is a phenomenal blend of premium nicaraguan long-fillers, aged for several years to achieve optimal flavor and aroma. tasting notes of cocoa powder, cedar, leather, pepper, cinnamon, almond, and baking spices layer the palate before a profoundly smooth finish. add this elite nicaraguan blend to your humidor today.

padrón cigars debuted in 1964 after brand founder and legendary cigar-maker josé orlando padrón departed his native cuba and started over in the u.s., eventually launching his renowned cigar factory in estelí, nicaragua. today, padrón cigars are ranked among the finest in the world, and the original blend is the perfect introduction to this award-wining brand. padrón cigars are blended in either a 93-rated natural nicaraguan wrapper or a 94-rated nicaraguan maduro. inside both is a well-aged blend of premium nicaraguan long-fillers. padrón cigars impart notes of cedar, cocoa, nuts, pepper, baking spices, and more, and they’re well known for their box-pressed sizes, of which there are many to savor. choose your favorite shape and add this accessible and affordable cornerstone from padrón to your humidor today.

add to the cigar stash in your coolerdor with padilla single batch barrel in your choice of robusto, toro, and churchill formats. a glistening san andrés wrapper encapsulates a medium to full-bodied profile of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos. tasting notes of fresh-ground coffee, molasses, and spices please the palate with an easygoing, effortless burn. padilla proves time and time again, you can never have too many deeply discounted boxes tucked away in your man cave for the next poker night or herf that pops up on the calendar.

padilla serie 1968 black bear is a gem when enhancing the collection in your coolerdor with premium boutique brands is at the top of your cigar-shopping list. a dark and glimmering pennsylvania broadleaf wrapper cradles an intense, medium to full-bodied blend of cuban-seed long-fillers with a nice balance of spices and sweetness. impress your cigar-ransacking pals with billowing notes of coffee and dark chocolate in every draw. devour delicious, sub-wholesale discounts on a resplendent blowout from padilla without making a dent in your cigar allowance.

brand founder ernesto padilla named la terraza cigars for the fishing village in cuba where ernest hemingway docked his boat. reel in the biggest discounts in the usa on padilla la terraza maduro when you buy a box direct from the holt’s blowout bin! an oily nicaraguan maduro wrapper leaf covers a meaty blend of premium nicaraguan long-fillers in a trio of classic shapes handcrafted in honduras. indulge in a sweet and earthy amalgam of chocolate and coffee bean notes. shop tasty small-batch padilla gems at rock-bottom prices while supplies last!

la terraza is the name of a fishing village in cuba where ernest hemingway used to dock his boat. padilla brand founder ernesto padilla honors the town with his padilla la terraza cigars. scoop up boxes of la terraza connecticut for pennies on the dollar and add handcrafted honduran-made gems to your coolerdor before an army of curmudgeonly connoisseurs beats you to our inventory. a golden connecticut wrapper leaf conceals a mellow and nutty blend of premium nicaraguan long-fillers in a handful of traditional sizes. notes of cedar and baking spices caress the palate from beginning to end. reel in padilla at rock-bottom prices from your pals at holt’s today!

okay, okay. you need some golf ‘gars that don’t cost a fortune, but won’t stink up the country club or cause your buddy to put the top down on his convertible in the rain. padilla fumas maduro could be just the ticket. pick up a magnificent mixed-filler recipe of nicaraguan tobaccos that rest beneath an oily maduro wrapper fermented to a splendid standard in honduras. handcrafted notes of dark chocolate, raisins, and espresso beans accompany mellow spices from start to finish. we guarantee you’ll pounce on padilla like a panther at the first puff, no matter how severe your affliction with frugality happens to be.

get any gluttonous urges for cigars out of your system with padilla fumas habano at prices that make penny stocks look steep. a chewy habano wrapper from honduras blankets a balanced interior of nicaraguan tobaccos that burn perfectly. score a resplendent, medium to full-bodied, cuban-sandwich profile of leather, earth, peppers, and coffee beans guaranteed to impress any pals who raid your humidor while you’re upstairs pleading with your spouse to let them hang out in your man cave a little longer.

padilla fumas connecticut delivers the pinnacle of nuttiness with a premium, mixed-filler concoction at downright concussing discounts. handcrafted in honduras from a tasty amalgam of nicaraguan core tobaccos beneath a creamy ecuador connecticut wrapper leaf, a mild to medium-bodied profile chauffeurs notes of coffee beans, spices and a touch of sweetness around the edges. padilla pumps out yet another easy-tasting hit you can handout down in your man cave to cigar-pilfering pals who love to mooch without making a dent in your cigar allowance, son!

boutique brand owner ernesto padilla created padilla dominus roughly one decade ago. dominus, which is latin for “master” shows padilla’s talent for creating consistently tasteful and well-made cigars at rock-bottom prices. value and flavor converge in a full-bodied profile of premium nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos beneath an oily corojo wrapper leaf. padilla dominus is handcrafted in honduras in a handful of popular formats. back in the day, the blend scored 92 points in cigar aficionado thanks to a spicy and luscious display of leather, dark fruits, and black pepper with a sweet and spicy finish.

padilla cazadores make a great first choice when you want to entice your cigar-pilfering pals with a tasteful profile directly from the holt’s blowout bin. a glistening ecuador habano wrapper conceals a premium cuban sandwich blend of nicaraguan tobaccos in handful of popular formats handcrafted in honduras. creamy, medium-bodied flavors of coffee, cocoa, and black pepper complete the equation with silky aromas and a luscious aftertaste you can’t pass up for a mind-blowing sub-wholesale discount. go on a hoarding spree and load the cooolerdor at the cheapest padilla prices in the country, friends!

pick up padilla artemis when you fancy affordable boutique handmades with consistent taste and construction. a medium to full-bodied profile of cedar, peppers, and earth delivers a sweet and zesty finish in a handful of classic shapes. padilla artemis is drawn from an oily reddish-brown nicaraguan wrapper leaf and an all-nicaraguan recipe of premium binder and filler tobaccos handmade in honduras. put padilla in the coolerdor before you’re hosting the next poker night down in your man cave.

foundation cigars brand founder nick melillo debuted olmec maduro in 2022. the olmec line pays tribute to the ancient mesoamerican people who inhabited the region in mexico where the cigar’s dark and oily san andrés wrapper is cultivated. beneath the wrapper leaf, a vibrant interior of well-aged nicaraguan long-fillers from estelí and jalapa is handcrafted in a handful of popular sizes. tasting notes of espresso bean, cocoa, leather, and earth reveal sweet and spicy nuances before a medium to full-bodied finish. because the tobaccos are fermented slowly at lower temperatures, their naturally flavorful oils are preserved, imparting complexity and smoothness. olmec maduro cigars are handmade at the aj fernandez factory in esteli, nicaragua.

foundation cigars brand founder nick melillo pays tribute to the ancient mesoamerican people of mexico’s san andrés region with olmec claro. a toothy san andrés wrapper leaf embraces a hearty interior of vintage nicaraguan long-fillers from estelí and jalapa. olmec claro imparts notes of almond, malted milk chocolate, and coffee bean before hints of crème brûlée punctuate the cigar’s medium to full-bodied profile in a collection of popular sizes. slow fermentation at lower temperatures ensures the tobaccos retain their naturally flavorful oils before the finished product is rolled. following its debut in 2022, the blend was rated 93 points in cigar aficionado. olmec claro is handmade at the aj fernandez factory in estelí, nicaragua. savor a small-batch nicaraguan smoke from the growing foundation portfolio today.

oliva serie v melanio maduro is a 95-rated bestseller and follow-up to the original serie v melanio, the brand’s first ‘#1 cigar of the year’ in cigar aficionado, in 2014. serie v melanio maduro is sheathed in a dark and succulent san andrés wrapper leaf over a magnificent blend of mature nicaraguan long-fillers harvested in the jalapa region. choose your favorite format from a collection of traditional box-pressed shapes and some bigger ring gauge sizes. an indulgent profile of german chocolate cake, malted chocolate, cedar, baking spices, nougat, and black pepper culminate in a tantalizing, medium to full-bodied finish with more sweetness than the original serie v melanio, courtesy of a hearty maduro wrapper. taste another hit from the acclaimed oliva portfolio today.

oliva serie v melanio belongs at the top of the list for most oliva fanatics thanks to a 96-point rating and scoring the ‘#1 cigar of the year’ title from cigar aficionado in 2014. an exquisite ecuador sumatra wrapper leaf blankets a rich marriage of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos patiently handcrafted in a striking box-pressed format in a handful of classic shapes. the medium to full-bodied profile delivers peppery notes of caramel and wood. an overriding creaminess showers the finish and sets serie v melanio apart in the oliva portfolio courtesy of its rich flavor, flawless construction and stunning aroma. taste the evolution of the oliva brand with a top-shelf classic you’re guaranteed to admire.

initially conceived as an annual limited edition, oliva serie v maduro is now available year-round. based on the ultra-popular, 95-rated original oliva serie v blend, the maduro version is drafted from a hearty combination nicaraguan ligero long-fillers beneath a sweet and spicy san andrés wrapper leaf. notes of cocoa, coffee, black pepper, and wood deliver a full-bodied finish with a creamy kick. add another sought-after, handmade nicaraguan gem from the award-winning oliva brand to your collection with oliva serie v maduro.

oliva serie v is a fan-favorite among cigar lovers who relish full-bodied, spicy cigars. handmade from the finest nicaraguan long-fillers and choicest ecuador habano wrappers, oliva serie v displays a creamy, chocolaty flavor-core around which a web of earthy and leathery nuances is woven. these phenomenal flavors and superb construction have earned the serie v a lengthy list of 90+ ratings and have resulted in big-time sales. nevertheless, these cigars remain very limited and hard to come by. if you are lucky enough to locate a box or two of these beauties, do not hesitate to buy them up immediately.

the 90-rated oliva serie o maduro is handcrafted in estelí, nicaragua from a complex recipe of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos beneath a toothy, dark, and glistening connecticut broadleaf wrapper. medium to full-bodied notes of dark chocolate, espresso beans, and earthy black peppers resonate in a handful of iconic shapes for a great everyday value. watch your pals marvel as the sweet and spicy aroma of oliva serie o maduro emanates throughout your man cave. mouths are guaranteed to water, but thankfully these punchy smokes are a joy to share with oliva’s award-winning reputation and a price that’s easy on the pocketbook.

handcrafted in estelí, nicaragua, oliva serie o debuted in cigar aficionado’s ‘top 25’ back in 2012 with an impressive 94-point score. an oily ecuador habano wrapper surrounds a hearty interior of premium nicaraguan long-fillers matured for perfect flavor. tasting notes of almond, cocoa, leather, and wood mingle with hints of molasses before a medium-bodied finish layers the palate. oliva serie o cigars are handmade in several classic sizes for a great value. add oliva serie o to your rotation without breaking the bank and find out why today’s cigar lovers prize this bestselling smoke from the award-winning oliva portfolio.

oliva serie g maduro cigars are blended from a dark and decadent san andrés wrapper leaf and a balanced core of premium nicaraguan long-fillers aged for maximum smoothness. hearty notes of dark cocoa, anise, and black pepper converge in a succulent and spicy, medium-bodied profile. savor this box-pressed classic, rated 93 points in cigar aficionado, for an unbeatable value from the award-winning oliva brand. oliva cigars are handmade by master rollers in estelí, nicaragua, from the finest tobaccos. serie g maduro is worthy of your regular rotation.

cameroon wrappers have been lauded by aficionados for decades. former ‘#1 cigar of the year’ titleholder oliva produces a tasty authentic cameroon-wrapped gem called oliva serie g. the 91-rated smoke is drafted from a gingerbread-hued african leaf over a cuban-seed recipe of nicaraguan long-fillers handmade to deliver an easy burn in a nice array of shapes. notes of nuts, cedar, black pepper, and coffee beans accompany woody aromas with a sweet and nutty finish. rely on oliva serie g when you want the good stuff at an agreeable everyday selling price.

the world-renowned oliva brand is home to several celebrated cigars, including the 96-rated oliva serie v melanio, the 95-rated oliva serie v, the 94-rated oliva serie o, and the 92-rated oliva master blends 3. discover one of the brand’s rarest creations to date with oliva monticello, a superb medium to full-bodied blend drafted from the company’s oldest reserves of premium aged tobaccos. a dark and oily nicaraguan maduro wrapper embraces a supreme blend of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos, matured for maximum smoothness, in a collection of popular soft box-pressed sizes. creamy notes of dark cocoa, cashew, and coffee bean accompany hints of cinnamon with a balanced spice before a stunning finish blesses the palate. oliva monticello is meticulously handcrafted by the most experienced cigar rollers at the company’s factory in estelí, nicaragua. add a rare and sought-after gem from oliva to your collection today.

oliva master blends 3 is a 92-rated gem drafted from exclusive tobaccos the award-winning brand initially reserved for oliva family members only. the supremely rare blend was originally released in select quantities to the general public on an annual basis only and has become a coveted cigar among oliva fans as well as cigar-lovers who prefer a top-shelf nicaraguan profile. a lustrous connecticut broadleaf wrapper conceals a hearty and luscious core of cuban-seed, nicaraguan ligero tobaccos procured from prized oliva family estates. well-rounded notes of dark chocolate and coffee with cream accompany earthy spices with a touch of brown sugar and leather throughout a mouthwatering finish. despite the numerous top-rated cigars in oliva's portfolio, master blends 3 is routinely considered the brand's true crown jewel!

named for oliva’s family patriarch, gilberto oliva reserva blanc honors the brand’s legacy with a rich combination of premium handcrafted long-filler tobaccos from ecuador and nicaragua cradled by a silky ecuador connecticut wrapper leaf. the medium-bodied profile is patiently hand-rolled in nicaragua to furnish elegant notes of toasted almonds, cashews and buttery spices with a creamy and pleasant room note. taste an evolution in a wildly popular brand since winning cigar aficionado’s coveted ‘#1 cigar of the year’ back in 2014.

oliva cigars honors modern family patriarch gilberto oliva with a luscious blend handcrafted in estelí, nicaragua. oliva gilberto oliva reserva delivers dark, creamy spices in a medium-bodied profile with sweet edges of caramel, cocoa and earth. a succulent sumatra wrapper embraces a leathery core of long-filler tobaccos from ecuador and nicaragua. indulge in rich, enticing flavors from the award-winning oliva brand.

oliva conceals a riveting, all-nicaraguan blend of tobaccos beneath a smooth and creamy connecticut-seed wrapper from ecuador to create oliva connecticut reserve. a subtle and very refined smoke is exuded by these blonde cigars; featuring a creamy, buttery character with a sweet, nutty finish. mild to medium-bodied and oh so smooth, these are the perfect cigars to complement to your morning cup of joe.

since its inception in 2006, old henry has become a bona fide cult classic and has achieved a permanent residence in the hearts and humidors of cigar connoisseurs worldwide. handcrafted with passion and precision in small-batch fashion by the legendary jose ‘pepin’ garcia, pure breed is drafted from oscuro-grade ecuador sumatra wrappers and select, premium aged nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos. sweet, smooth and buttery notes of caramel and nuts segue into pepin’s trademark spice with delicious, peppery aromas in an original medium to full-bodied profile. the exquisite and oily sheen on each wrapper lives up to its expectation, ushering pure breed firmly into the old henry portfolio with pride and popularity. welcome home your new best friend and constant companion, old henry pure breed!

old henry maduro is a rare treat indeed. blended and manufactured in nicaragua by jose “pepin” garcia, old henry maduro continues the trend of affordable excellence that the original old henry started. crafted using the same blend of extra-aged nicaraguan tobaccos, old henry maduro retains that irresistible, earthy spice and builds upon it with flavors of semi-sweet cocoa and creamy leather thanks to its high-grade connecticut broadleaf maduro wrapper. the perfect after-dinner cigar, or at any time of day for that matter, old henry maduro is a must-try for cigar enthusiasts.

old henry gold label shows off the smoother side of this prize-winning pedigree. jose “pepin” garcia combines the classic old henry blend with a brand new connecticut-seed wrapper grown in ecuador that’s so smooth and creamy you won’t believe it’s not butter. thanks to this silky wrapper, old henry’s trademark earthy spice is subdued and supplemented by regal notes of cream and cinnamon. this stunning new rendition boasts an approachable, medium-bodied strength that’s mild enough to smoke in the morning yet rich and flavorful enough to round out an evening.

old henry is named for the beloved 4-legged best friend of your pals at holt’s from a number of years back. our proud pooch is no longer with us, but his legacy lives on in our prized old henry franchise, blended and handcrafted by the esteemed jose ‘pepin’ garcia in estelí, nicaragua. old henry fumadores deliver the maximum in both flavor and value with a premium cuban-sandwich blend of all-nicaraguan tobaccos tucked under a toothy ecuador habano wrapper leaf. a rich bouquet of dark chocolate and cedar greets the nose with sharp spices and awe-inspiring aroma. add a medium-bodied gem to your rotation from an award-winning cigar-maker at a price that can’t be beat. long live old henry!

old henry is a best-selling cigar with an avid cult following. this brand has been hugely successful due to the fact that it is one of the finest cigars for the money in the entire cigar world. handcrafted in nicaragua by jose “pepin” garcia, old henry features a brash bouquet of rich, spicy flavors along with impeccable construction. beneath a thick, oily nicaraguan corojo wrapper lurks a spicy, full-bodied blend of aged nicaraguan tobaccos. ignition yields an incredibly rich spiciness; enough spice to make even the most seasoned smoker break a sweat. this spiciness then transitions nicely into hearty notes of earth, cedar and leather. finally, a creamy finish with a hint of nutmeg ices the cake. old henry is a prized cigar that deserves a home in every cigar lover’s humidor. long live old henry!

we know a ton of cigar lovers with a nub infatuation, and nine times out of ten, they’re in a rush. nub cigars are short and fat and get straight to the point as they’re blended and rolled to start off right at the sweet spot where optimal flavor and aroma kick in. if you’re running out the door with a few nub smokes in your pocket, put an end to crushing your precious cigar cargo by picking up nub tubes. colorful, sturdy aluminum tubes encapsulate your favorite nub blends, including nub cameroon, connecticut, habano, and maduro in the brand’s iconic 4 x 60 format.

the folks at oliva cigar company have crafted an ingenious marriage of tobacco and coffee flavors in their beloved nub line. savor tons of the creamy deliciousness from your favorite cup of joe with a nice variety of nub formats. nub nuance is available in 3 distinct varieties: single roast (cappuccino flavors), double roast (macchiato flavors), and triple roast (espresso flavors) . single roast features silky ecuador connecticut wrappers over a creamy amalgam of cedar, coffee beans and vanilla flavors. double roast delivers milky caramel flavors with a sugary profile tucked under chocolaty sumatra wrappers. triple roast utilizes a hearty sumatra wrapper to deliver an intoxicating aroma of dark cocoa and bittersweet toast. nub nuance covers all the bases when it comes to coffee and cigars, order yours today!

drafted from a succulent brazilian maduro wrapper leaf and a complex core of nicaraguan long-fillers, nub maduro presents the brand’s uber-popular short, squatty shapes with a spicy and sweet medium-bodied profile. nub maduro received an excellent 90-point rating in cigar aficionado. since 2007, nub cigars have captivated cigar lovers with their short, fat, and prominent shapes. the pioneering format of nub cigars is designed to begin and end with an optimally flavorful experience. the nub brand is handmade at the celebrated oliva factory in estelí, nicaragua. add nub maduro to your next purchase and delve into the blend’s dark chocolaty zest and signature nicaraguan spice.

the innovative shape of nub cigars debuted back in 2007. cigar lovers began devouring the brand thanks to its guarantee that the sweet spot of taste and aroma are captured right from the first puffs of these short, fat smokes. nub habano is drawn from a cuban-seed wrapper leaf grown in ecuador and a bulging core of all-nicaraguan long-fillers. notes of leather, earth, cayenne, and black pepper characterize the pudgy profile of nub habano. all nub cigars are patiently handmade at the award-winning oliva factory in estelí, nicaragua. add nub habano to your rotation for enticing, medium-bodied flavor with a pleasantly lingering finish.

if you love the short, fat shape of nub cigars and the spicy taste of a corojo wrapper leaf, nub corojo belongs in your humidor. a chunky blend of premium nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos fills out an oily reddish-brown corojo wrapper leaf in a pair of classic nub sizes. tasting notes of cedar, earth, red pepper, paprika, and leather reveal sweet hints of cocoa and nuts before a zesty finish kicks in. nub corojo is handmade at the award-winning oliva factory in esteli, nicaragua. indulge in a popular, plump, and medium-bodied profile from nub today!

since the brand’s debut in 2007, nub has been a favorite among scores of cigar lovers. the short, thick shapes of nub cigars were pioneered to deliver the maximum amount and flavor and aroma right off the bat when you fire one up. nub connecticut is drafted from luscious recipe of nicaraguan binder and filler tobacco beneath a silky, blond ecuador connecticut wrapper leaf. all nub cigars are handmade at the prestigious oliva factory in estelí, nicaragua. choose your favorite chunkified shape in nub connecticut when you’re craving a cool-burning profile of almonds, cashews, and white pepper.

the short, chunky shape of nub cigars has been pleasing the palates of cigar lovers for over ten years. the brand is handcrafted at the award-winning oliva factory in estelí, nicaragua. nub cameroon delivers delicious tasting notes of cedar, cinnamon, nuts, and earth with a touch of spice. the 92-rated nub cameroon comes in an array of the brand’s wildly popular thick and shorter shapes. nub sizes were designed to start off at the sweet spot of flavor and aroma. add nub cameroon to your rotation today.

data.cigar_name: new world puro especial by aj fernandez
data.cigar_description: fans of rising boutique cigar star aj fernandez will enjoy new world puro especial, an all-nicaraguan profile handcrafted in estelí, nicaragua. the medium-bodied puro is available in a handful of classic shapes and is blended from a complex amalgam of tobaccos grown on select fernandez farms. the shimmering wrapper embraces an earthy profile that delivers rich tasting notes of minerals, pepper, almonds and hickory with a balanced kick. add a burgeoning boutique brand to your collection with new world puro especial.

data.cigar_name: new world dorado by aj fernandez
data.cigar_description: popular cigar-maker aj fernandez adds to his new world portfolio with dorado, a nicaraguan puro drawn from a special blend of aj’s favorite tobaccos. dorado is spanish for gold, the is cigar named for one of aj’s nicaraguan estates where the soil is an uncharacteristically light-brown, golden color. a cuban-seed wrapper and a criollo ’98 binder from the dorado farm are blended with additional long-fillers from condega and estelí. a tangy, medium-bodied zest layers the palate with a hint of sweetness from the wrapper. succulent notes of white pepper, cedar, and cinnamon mingle before a hearty, nutty finish rounds out the foundation of another gem from aj fernandez.

data.cigar_name: new world connecticut by aj fernandez
data.cigar_description: new world connecticut features a sumptuously mild to medium-bodied profile of complex and subtle spices. golden-hued connecticut shade wrappers cover an approachable amalgam of aged long-fillers from brazil and nicaragua fortified by a san andrés binder. smooth and seamless draws offer rich flavors of cedar and coffee with a creamy finish. new world connecticut is handcrafted in nicaragua and is a great cigar for fans of the original new world blend looking for a milder profile to add to their collections.

data.cigar_name: new world cameroon by aj fernandez
data.cigar_description: boutique blending sensation aj fernandez expands his ever-growing portfolio with new world cameroon. a glistening cameroon wrapper leaf embraces a hearty, full-bodied core of all-nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos. choose from a handful of traditional shapes handcrafted in estelí, nicaragua. ample notes of wood, coffee beans, cocoa, and cedar deliver a mix of sweet and spicy impressions from start to finish. add a meaty, cameroon-wrapped boutique to your collection today.

christopher columbus’ famous voyage in 1492 led not only to the discovery of the new world, but also the introduction of tobacco to europe. new world is a cigar blended by aj fernandez to commemorate this momentous occasion. deep and darkly hued nicaraguan wrappers cradle a fortified pairing of long-filler core components from three key regions in nicaragua with medium to full-bodied notes of earth, spicy espresso and sharp, sweet hints of dark chocolate. new world features a distinctly zesty aroma that enlivens the senses with a smooth and complex profile. the finish is crisp and bold with a rich aftertaste and the construction yields an effortless draw. try new world today and add an exquisite discovery to your humidor today!

nat sherman timeless supreme is blended for the small-batch boutique portfolio of the historic nat sherman brand. the all-nicaraguan blend is handcrafted in a handful of classic shapes that deliver notes of dark cocoa, cedar, molasses, and nuts. the medium-bodied profile reveals a cool, well-made draw with a touch of spices. formerly called nat sherman timeless nicaragua, the blend scored 92 points in cigar aficionado with a ‘top 25’ ranking for 2015.

nat sherman timeless prestige is drawn from a cocoa-hued honduran wrapper leaf over an eventful blend of binder and filler tobaccos from the dominican republic and nicaragua. the medium to full-bodied profile reveals notes of maple, leather, and wood with an earthy finish in a handful of traditional shapes. the small-batch, new york-based label scored 93 points in cigar aficionado as well as a ‘top 25’ rating for 2013 with nat sherman timeless prestige, formerly called nat sherman timeless dominican.

ultimate father and son cigar-makers josé and jaime garcia have won cigar aficionado’s coveted ‘#1 cigar of the year’ twice in a recent four-year span. with demand for their succulent nicaraguan cigar brands at an all-time high, we highly recommend adding my father the judge to your collection today. cinnamon-hued ecuador sumatra wrappers cover a full-bodied recipe of select nicaraguan tobaccos grown on garcia family estates. taste a magnificent profile of leather, cedar, nuts and signature spices in another gem from a brand at the top of its game.

data.cigar_name: my father limited edition pepin mania 10th anniversary
data.cigar_description: my father pepin mania 10th anniversary is an exclusive 6-by-52 toro blended to commemorate ten years of our annual my father pepin mania events at holt’s – one of the biggest and best-attended cigar events in the industry. the 10th anniversary is drawn from a seamless san andrés oscuro wrapper and a proprietary blend of premium nicaraguan long-fillers, cultivated on garcia family estates, assembled by legendary cigar-maker josé ‘pepin’ garcia. my father pepin mania 10th anniversary resonates with notes of cocoa, hickory, espresso bean, and leather throughout a savory and spicy smoke before its long, elaborate finish arrives. the cigars were aged for three additional years after they were rolled to achieve the oily complexion and irresistible flavor they possess. secure a box of these super-premium rarities for your collection before we’re sold out!

data.cigar_name: my father limited edition pepin mania
data.cigar_description: indulge in an ultra-rare, small-batch exclusive called my father limited edition pepin mania in a 6-by-52 soft-box-pressed toro. every year, your pals at holt’s host an insanely popular my father event in our historic retail smokeshops, and master cigar-maker josé ‘pepin’ garcia blended a special cigar to commemorate the celebration and thank all the cigar lovers who attend. my father limited edition pepin mania is a proprietary rarity drawn from a full-bodied recipe of vintage nicaraguan long-fillers, grown on garcia family estates, blended under a dark and toothy connecticut broadleaf wrapper matured to perfection. the finished cigars rest for an additional three years in special aging rooms at the garcia family’s modern cigar factory in estelí, nicaragua. a captivating profile of dark chocolate, black pepper, leather, and espresso bean displays marvelous spices in the nose before a luxuriant and sweet finish layers the palate. add an exclusive super-premium to your collection from the prized pepin portfolio today!

my father le bijou 1922 hails from celebrated father-and-son cigar-makers jose ‘pepin’ garcia and jaime garcia in estelí, nicaragua. the 97-rated blend scored cigar aficionado’s ‘#1 cigar of the year’ honors in 2015. a lustrous cuban-seed wrapper harvested in ecuador shimmers over a full-bodied interior of bold but well-aged nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos. just as the original my father blend was a tribute from jaime to pepin, my father le bijou 1922 is pepin’s homage to his own father. potent notes of leather, earth, espresso beans, and dark cocoa command the senses with layers of spice from beginning to end. indulge in a nicaraguan masterpiece handmade from the garcia family’s finest tobaccos in a collection of classic shapes.

celebrated cigar-maker jose ‘pepin’ garcia created my father la promesa as an homage to his family and the promise he made to them when he left cuba in the early 2000s and started over in the u.s. pepin promised to succeed as a cigar-maker and it’s clear today that he has fulfilled his pledge with two ‘#1 cigar of the year’ titles for the 96-rated flor de las antillas and the 97-rated my father le bijou 1922. my father la promesa is drafted from a cuban-seed wrapper grown in ecuador and a medium to full-bodied recipe of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos. the nutty, woody, and zesty profile is handcrafted in a variety of popular shapes.

in addition to a steady stream of sky-high ratings and two previous ‘#1 cigar of the year’ titles from cigar aficionado, the my father brand adds to its celebrated portfolio with my father la opulencia, the 95-rated ‘#2 cigar of the year’ for 2018. legendary father-and-son cigar-makers pepin and jaime garcia blend a superb recipe of premium aged tobaccos to their uncompromising standards for flavor and aroma. a glistening and perfectly fermented san andrés oscuro wrapper leaf conceals a hearty mixture of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos patiently matured for optimal taste. a potent, full-bodied profile delivers earthy notes of wood, black pepper, espresso beans, and signature nicaraguan spices with a leathery texture and intriguing aroma. for fans of hearty nicaraguan cigars, my father la opulencia guarantees to please.

with two previous ‘#1 cigar of the year’ titles from cigar aficionado for the 97-rated my father le bijou 1922 and the 96-rated flor de las antillas, the garcia family continues a tradition of growing, aging, and blending premium tobaccos that is second to none. legendary cigar-maker jose ‘pepin’ garcia and his son, jaime garcia, deliver tremendous flavor in my father la gran oferta with an oily cuban-seed wrapper grown in ecuador and an aged interior of all-nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos. a medium to full-bodied profile reveals marvelously balanced spices in conjunction with wood, leather, and molasses notes. la gran oferta translates to ‘the great offer’ which was originally the name of a cigar brand made many decades ago. intricate artwork on the boxes and the bands reflects the old-world look of the original brand. the blend is available in a handful of classic shapes handmade at the renowned my father factory in estelí, nicaragua.

my father gives iconic cuban-legacy brand fonseca a complete facelift with all-new cigars blended by celebrated father-and-son cigar-makers jose ‘pepin’ garcia and jaime garcia in estelí, nicaragua. bringing fonseca into the award-winning my father portfolio sheds new light on a traditional collection sure to create a stir with a medium to full-bodied blend handmade from premium aged nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos tucked beneath an oily reddish-brown corojo rosado wrapper leaf. notes of coffee beans, leather, and cocoa mingle before a nutty zest sets in. signature nicaraguan spices magnify a woody finish in a handful of classic shapes. add the new my father fonseca to your rotation for a refreshing take on an old-school brand from the garcia family today.

my father connecticut is an outstanding and dynamic addition from my father cigars. blended by jose 'pepin' garcia and jaime garcia at their state-of-the-art factory in esteli, nicaragua, my father connecticut features a well-aged selection of nicaraguan binder and fillers that provide a sumptuous background of signature spice and earthy notes. a gorgeous and smooth ecuador connecticut wrapper highlights rich, creamy flavors with a nutty nuance. my father connecticut also features a very rare and unique aromatic leaf that goes through a special fermentation process to shape a truly distinct profile. the garcias are delighted with the results and proud to feature this exceptional blend in their burgeoning portfolio.

my father is a wonderful cigar created by jaime garcia in dedication to his father, jose “pepin” garcia. handcrafted in estelí, nicaragua, my father showcases a glorious ecuador habano wrapper and lovely blend of aged nicaraguan tobaccos. full-bodied in strength, these cigars offer an earthy core of flavor around which an enticing web of sweet cedar and nuts is spun. a peppery spice permeates every inch of this cigar and leaves your mouth watering when you finally nub it.

handmade in the dominican republic, montesino boasts the same consistency and quality you have come to expect from the fuente factory. these mild-bodied masterpieces are an incredible steal and please the palate on every level. rolled from a selection of mellow dominican tobaccos and finished with a connecticut wrapper, these affordable cigars usher forth a smooth, creamy flavor supplemented by either a dark chocolaty sweetness brought in by the maduro wrapper, or a light nuttiness if you’re puffing on the naturals. both are excellent, low-cost humidor essentials.

montecristo has been a globally recognized brand name for years. white vintage connecticut is a flavorful and enticing release from montecristo, handcrafted in the dominican republic. golden connecticut shade wrappers envelop a complex pairing of dominican, nicaraguan and peruvian long-filler tobaccos with flawless construction and an even burn. elegant notes of coffee, cedar and sweet spices reveal a creamy and savory finish.

montecristo white cigars are blended for cigar lovers who want a cigar that’s just a touch stronger and more complex than the original montecristo blend. montecristo white is handcrafted with a light-brown ecuador connecticut wrapper leaf and a rich amalgam of vintage dominican and nicaragua long-fillers. a medium-bodied profile of fresh pepper, honey, cedar, and coffee with cream layers the taste buds in a collection of balanced and classic sizes. add montecristo white to your humidor, and broaden your palate with a mellow and rich smoke from one of the world’s most iconic brands.

taste a handcrafted profile from the famous montecristo brand in the esteemed platinum series. a lustrous san andrés wrapper cradles a complex core of dominican, nicaraguan and peruvian long-filler tobaccos. medium to full-bodied notes of cedar, oak and roasted espresso beans lead to a malty finish with hints of salt and cocoa. choose from a balanced variety of handmade shapes and experience original flavors from a classic brand.

in recent years, boutique cigar-maker aj fernandez has been revving up, revamping, and reimagining a laundry list of cuban-legacy brands with inventive new blends in order to inject a fresh bit of pizzazz into their portfolios. montecristo nicaragua is a medium to full-bodied creation fernandez blended from an all-nicaraguan recipe of rich and flavorful tobaccos handmade in a variety of classic, cool-burning formats. woody notes of coffee, leather, nutmeg, and black pepper propel the historic montecristo franchise into an era of aj fernandez alongside the work he’s done with a number of established brands, including romeo y julieta and h. upmann. indulge in the marriage of a popular boutique cigar-maker and the celebrated montecristo brand name.

monte by montecristo is drawn from an oily cuban-seed wrapper grown in ecuador and a medium to full-bodied blend of well-aged dominican long-fillers inside a nicaraguan corojo binder. a decadent profile of leather, chocolate, wood, and pepper pleases in a 93-rated blend that’s a touch stronger than traditional dominican-made montecristo cigars. a nutty, lingering finish resonates with hints of dark-roast coffee and sweet spices. taste the evolution of a world-famous brand in a series of popular sizes today.

montecristo is a brand name of monumental proportions sought out by cigar lovers around the globe for decades. as the most full-bodied cigar in the brand’s portfolio, montecristo epic is befitting of its title. big brand name cigar enthusiasts in search of gargantuan notes of spicy cocoa, coffee and earth need to look no further. an oily ecuador habano wrapper encompasses a boisterous combination of dominican and nicaraguan core tobaccos for full effect. get to know montecristo epic cigars now!

montecristo classic delivers the same mellow and smooth flavor that’s made the original dominican montecristo a global bestseller. tasting notes of coffee bean, earth, cedar, and crème brûlée bless the palate with creamy and nutty texture and hints of white pepper in a collection of traditional sizes. a golden-blond connecticut shade wrapper embraces a sumptuous blend of premium dominican long-fillers in a cigar rated 91 points by the critics in cigar aficionado.

montecristo aj fernandez combines the renowned cuban-legacy of one of the most recognized brands in the world with the talents of boutique cigar-maker aj fernandez. handcrafted in nicaragua, a medium to full-bodied recipe of vintage long-fillers from the dominican republic and nicaragua is bound by a glistening cuban-seed wrapper. notes of dark chocolate, cashews, walnuts, and sweet peppers coalesce in a handful of classic formats that burn perfectly.

montecristo commemorates 85 years as a leading cigar brand with the 1935 anniversary nicaragua blend. cigar aficionado awarded montecristo 1935 anniversary nicaragua its official ‘#2 cigar of the year’ honors with a 95-point rating for 2021. montecristo cigars enjoy an immense audience thanks to their deep cuban roots and their rich, approachable taste. 1935 anniversary nicaragua is a luxurious, soft box-pressed collection blended by aj fernandez from a premium amalgam of vintage nicaraguan long-fillers tucked under an oily, reddish-brown nicaraguan wrapper leaf. a medium to full-bodied profile of leather, red pepper, and malted milk chocolate mingles with earthy undertones before a long and lingering finish of hickory and cedar layers the palate. taste the evolution of an iconic cuban-legacy brand as only aj fernandez can imagine it.

montecristo is a household name in the cigar world. smokers worldwide know they can count on montecristo for a well-made, dominican-bred cigar when their tastes trend towards high quality, mild-bodied strength. a light, connecticut-grown wrapper leaf holds a well-aged blend of dominican fillers together and adds a creamy finish to the sweet, grassy taste of the fillers. smooth and easy-smoking, montecristo is an easy choice for many a cigar connoisseur.

crowned heads brand founder jon huber has built a portfolio of popular small-batch cigars, including the 91-rated mil días line. blended from an oily ecuador habano wrapper leaf and a complex core of long-filler tobaccos from nicaragua, costa rica, and peru, mil dias is patiently handmade in estelí, nicaragua. tasting notes of leather, coffee bean, caramel, and nuts layer the palate before a tangy and woody finish resonates in a collection of well-made sizes. mil dias means “1,000 days” in spanish and is a reference to the number of days huber spent perfecting the blend with the cigar-makers. add this quality, small-production cigar to your rotation today.

man o’ war virtue cigars hail from nicaragua where they’re handcrafted from a golden-blond ecuador connecticut wrapper leaf over an ample blend of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos. tasting notes of buttered toast, cashew, and almond mingle with hints of oak and coffee with cream in a series of classic sizes. man o’ war virtue fits the bill when you’re craving a mild to medium-bodied cigar you can smoke any time of the day for a decent value. choose your favorite size in a sumptuous box of 22 silky, smooth smokes.

man o’ war ruination stirs the senses with ample intensity in a full-bodied blend handcrafted in a series of classic formats. toasty and spicy tasting notes of hickory, oak, earth, and red and black peppers propel the taste buds to an utter state of bliss. a complex recipe of cuban-seed nicaraguan and honduran ligero long-fillers rests beneath an oily ecuador habano wrapper leaf. pass out man o’ war ruination to pals who are prepared for vigorous taste with a big lingering finish a bold room note to match.

small-batch cigar-making extraordinaire aj fernandez has landed square on the radar of critics and cigar lovers in recent years with a growing portfolio of top-rated cigars. among his early standouts is man o’ war, a boutique blend handmade from a hearty bevy of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos tucked under an oily ecuador habano wrapper leaf. tasting notes of cocoa, coffee beans, baking spices, wood, and pepper promote a medium to full-bodied profile with splendid aromas.

macanudo cigars are famous for being consistently mild, mellow and smooth. a light blend of dominican and mexican tobaccos creates a mild foundation on top of which the connecticut broadleaf wrapper adds a subtle layer of creamy sweetness. if mild and sweet is your smoking preference then macanudo maduro is just the ticket.

iconic brand macanudo reveals a refreshing expression with inspirado white. creamy, mild to medium-bodied notes of buttered toast, coffee beans and cereal deliver marvelous transitions of flavor. an ecuador connecticut wrapper harnesses a complex recipe of indonesian, nicaraguan and mexican long-filler tobaccos with an even burn and consistent balance. taste inspirado white in a classic size today.

macanudo inspirado red extends the brand’s iconic portfolio with a beefier, full-bodied release dressed in a red-and-silver band. while many macanudo smokes are noted for their approachable flavor and mellow finish, inspirado red is handmade in nicaragua and delivers a peppery amalgam of wood, leather, and dried fruit with an ample, zesty finish. a reddish-hued cuban-seed wrapper leaf embraces a robust core of nicaraguan and honduran long-filler tobaccos. macanudo fans searching for a spicier after-dinner cigar can choose from a handful of classic shapes crafted to embrace an audience for stronger smokes.

originally released for the european market, the popularity of macanudo inspirado prompted its release in the u.s. macanudo inspirado orange broadens the horizon for the classic, iconic brand in a medium-bodied profile handmade in honduras. a dark, cocoa-hued wrapper leaf hugs a complex recipe of dominican, nicaraguan, and honduran long-fillers. a handful of traditional shapes delivers hearty flavors of earth, coffee beans, and cayenne peppers with a zesty finish. taste the latest from macanudo with the rich and chewy aroma of macanudo inspirado orange.

get acquainted with a medium to full-bodied blend from the iconic macanudo brand courtesy of inspirado black. a glistening habano wrapper grown in connecticut embraces a complex, handcrafted combination of dominican, honduran and nicaraguan tobaccos. notes of coffee bean, chocolate, wood, and toasted nuts mingle with a bit more kick than you’ll find in a more traditional macanudo profile. taste the evolution of a classic in an ideal cigar for after dinner.

indulge in an iconic, silky limited-edition with macanudo gold label. a light brown connecticut shade wrapper conceals a smooth and sweet mixture of binder and filler tobaccos from the dominican republic and san andrés. notes of buttered toast and coffee with cream deliver a touch of spice in a handful of classic macanudo formats. taste a revered seasonal release from a famous name brand.

macanudo cru royale offers a medium-bodied profile courtesy of an oily ecuador habano wrapper over a complex mix of nicaraguan, dominican and brazilian long-filler tobaccos. tasting notes of leather, almonds, cashews and spice populate the blend with an approachable draw. enjoy a 91-rated cigar with an added bit of richness and strength from the iconic macanudo brand.
