macanudo café cigars have been among the bestselling mild dominican premiums for decades. new cigar lovers and novices prefer the approachable flavor and aroma macanudo café offers, and this iconic blend is available everywhere cigars are sold. a golden-blond connecticut shade wrapper surrounds a mellow blend of long-filler tobaccos harvested in the dominican republic and mexico. several classic cuban sizes bless the palate with creamy, easygoing notes of cedar, coffee bean, nuts, and a hint of spice. macanudo was the first premium cigar brand produced outside of cuba to gain widespread popularity in the u.s. following the cuban trade embargo. more than fifty-five years later, macanudo cigars possess immense staying power. add a box of the 91-rated macanudo café to your humidor for an approachable classic more aficionados count as their first cigar than nearly any other brand in the world.

data.cigar_name: liga undercrown sun grown by drew estate
data.cigar_description: liga privada fans can add another blend to their rotations with undercrown sun grown. a complex, full-bodied profile consists of long-filler tobaccos from the dominican republic, nicaragua and indonesia. a hearty sun grown wrapper leaf from ecuador conceals the mix and delivers a spicy flavor with notes of cayenne pepper, coffee beans and leather. taste a rich blend from a popular boutique brand in a nice variety of balanced shapes.

data.cigar_name: liga undercrown shade by drew estate
data.cigar_description: the undercrown blend was developed by drew estate as an alternative to the original liga privada, created from more abundant leaf primings for the purpose of increasing production. handcrafted in nicaragua, the undercrown shade features a medium-bodied profile of indonesian, dominican and nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos enrobed in a silky ecuador connecticut wrapper. notes of toasted white pepper, sweetened tea and nuts lead to a creamy finish. fans of the liga blends interested in a slightly milder, more approachable cigar will enjoy liga undercrown shade.

the story behind liga undercrown is that the rollers in the drew estate factory in estelí, nicaragua were smoking so many liga privada cigars they were told to stop due to the scarce production and high demand. the workers developed a plan to use the same crop of excellent nicaraguan and brazilian tobaccos for the binder and fillers, but they selected leaves from different primings of the plant and a different wrapper leaf. they chose a dark san andrés negro for its rich oily texture, sweet and spicy taste, and its broader availability. the 91-rated blend delivers tasting notes of fresh ground coffee, hickory, vanilla beans, and pepper in a medium to full-bodied smoke. buy liga undercrown cigars for a more affordable and equally savory profile as the original liga privada blend.

liga privada undercrown 10 commemorates the tenth anniversary of drew estate’s popular undercrown line. an especially dark and oily san andrés wrapper harbors a complex blend of nicaraguan long-fillers tucked inside a succulent connecticut broadleaf binder in a collection of classic shapes. sweet, spicy, and exuberant notes of cocoa, raisin, black pepper, espresso, and hickory satisfy the taste buds with bold, medium to full-bodied flavor and aroma. after smoking too many of the original liga privada cigars, the cigar-rollers at drew estate created the undercrown line to smoke while they work, and a decade later undercrown 10 proves their standards for taste, construction, and consistency remain high. add liga privada undercrown 10 to your collection today, and taste a cigar the rollers adore.

data.cigar_name: liga privada unico by drew estate
data.cigar_description: drew estate’s boutique liga privada franchise is crafted in estelí, nicaragua. the brand’s small-batch portfolio has grown to include a number of medium to full-bodied, sought-after smokes like the t52 and #9 blends. the liga privada unico series is a bit more elusive, but equally satisfying. peppery, sweet, and zesty, liga privada unico cigars are worthy of picking up when you want to impress your pals with hard-to-find limited editions from the popular liga privada line. pick up your favorite shapes before they’re sold out.

data.cigar_name: liga privada t52 by drew estate
data.cigar_description: liga privada t52 showcases a stalk-cut, habano-seed wrapper grown in ecuador. with the stalk-cut process, the tobacco plant is cut and hung in the aging-barn as a whole and the wrappers begin their fermentation process while still on the stalk. the result? well, when paired with a brazilian binder and nicaraguan and honduran filler blend (as is the case with the t52) it makes for a spicy, leathery cigar that develops tasty notes of coffee, cocoa, nuts and spice. medium to full-bodied and full-flavored, this cigar is an another non-infused winner from drew estate.

liga privada #9 is a rare treat from drew estate. blended by the mastermind jonathan drew using 100% non-infused tobaccos, these cigars are capped off with dark, oily connecticut broadleaf wrappers. liga privada #9 is full-bodied, full-flavored and potently-spicy. a smooth draw produces heavenly clouds of thick, chocolaty smoke laced with notes of roasted coffee beans and a rich spiciness on the finish.

licenciados is a good, moderately-priced, mild cigar. composed using a creamy blend of all-dominican tobaccos and blonde connecticut wrappers, these light-bodied handmades are easy to smoke any time of day. a light, nutty flavor and a creamy finish complements the mild-bodied demeanor exceedingly well.

las calaveras edición limitada 2023 cigars hail from the fellas at crowned heads, led by brand founder jon huber who enlisted the talents of master cigar-maker josé ‘pepin’ garcia to blend the company’s annual limited edition for 2023. a dark and toothy connecticut broadleaf wrapper conceals a hearty blend of vintage nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos from head to foot in a trio of classic sizes. sweet and peppery notes of cocoa, leather, and earth grace the palate throughout a medium to full-bodied finish. only 1,500 boxes of each size were made. add a box of these small-batch gems to your humidor before they’re gone for good.

la unica debuted back in 1986 at the fuente factory in the dominican republic. more than three decades later, la unica is a top-selling value brand you can easily add to the coolerdor when you need mild approachable cigars that don’t cost a fortune. a consistent recipe of cuban-seed dominican long-filler tobaccos rests beneath your choice of a connecticut shade or connecticut broadleaf wrapper. rich, nutty, and creamy tasting notes converge with a touch of spices in a handful of traditional shapes. add la unica to your daily rotation for reliable flavor and aroma in a fuente-made classic.

la perla habana classic is a great example of why you can have both quality and quantity in your coolerdor. miniscule prices marry big flavors that are rich, approachable and easy for cigar lovers with all kinds of different preferences to appreciate. a well-rounded sumatra wrapper conceals a complex blend of nicaraguan, honduran and dominican longer-fillers. bright flavors of cedar, leather, and creamy notes of earth offer a partially sweet and spicy finish. la perla habana classic is an all around great cigar for any occasion, and it won’t break the bank if your buddies stop by to raid your humidor.

introduce a value-priced gem into your coolerdor with la perla habana black pearl. a medium-bodied profile is created from dark chocolate-hued brazilian wrappers over a crisp combination of nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos. toasted notes of wood meld with a caramel-like sweetness with charred flavors of cedar and earth. black pearl is rich and zesty with a meaty finish and elegant construction. grab a box and on some strong coffee, these boomsticks are affordable and perfect for pulling an all-nighter!

la imperiosa comes to us from the tennessee-based, crowned heads brand. handmade in estelí, nicaragua, la imperiosa employs the same blend of tobaccos as crowned heads' previous limited-release, las calaveras. now in regular production, a dark and succulent ecuador habano wrapper cradles a medium to full-bodied blend of nicaraguan long-fillers. bright spices chauffer sweet notes of hickory and cedar with a balanced, earthy profile. la imperiosa delivers a satisfying finish in each of its refined shapes.

data.cigar_name: la gloria cubana serie r esteli maduro
data.cigar_description: la gloria cubana serie r estelí maduro is drafted from a robust amalgam of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos beneath an oily connecticut broadleaf wrapper. the blend is handmade in nicaragua in a collection of thicker ring gauge cigars. tasting notes of earth, dark cocoa, and espresso beans harbor a nice balance of bittersweet flavor and spice with smoky, leathery aroma before a lingering finish sets in. add a big brand to your coolerdor with the nicaraguan edition of la gloria serie r in a succulent maduro wrapper leaf.

data.cigar_name: la gloria cubana serie r esteli
data.cigar_description: la gloria cubana serie r estelí delivers a nutty and floral profile of coffee beans and notes of leather in a collection of bigger ring gauge shapes handcrafted in nicaragua. the classic dominican brand branches out into nicaragua with a medium to full-bodied recipe of nicaraguan binder, filler, and wrapper tobaccos. originally released as an exclusive for brick-and-mortar shops, you can order la gloria cubana serie r estelí online and save big on a 91-rated blend that cracked into cigar aficionado’s ‘top 25 cigars of the year’ back in 2014.

la gloria cubana serie r cigars have been popular since the 1990s as the demand for bigger ring gauge cigars entered the mainstream. originally created by award-winning cigar-maker ernesto perez carrillo, la gloria cubana is owned by general cigar company. serie r cigars are blended with a complex amalgam of dominican, nicaraguan, mexican, and brazilian long-fillers in two distinct wrappers. the natural version is finished in an ecuador sumatra, and the maduro is finished in an oily connecticut broadleaf. woody notes of earth, spices, and leather meld with a touch of dried fruit in serie r natural. baking spices like clove and cinnamon accompany a touch of dark cocoa and good amount of pepper in serie r maduro. enjoy the old-school taste of la gloria cuaban today.

la gloria cubana has been around for decades, seeing its way successfully through the cigar boom of the mid-90’s. featuring a steadfast blend of nicaraguan and dominican fillers, these cigars also employ two different wrapper options. the natural ecuadorian leaf adds a creamy note, or you can go a bit sweeter with the chocolaty, maduro wrapper from the connecticut river valley. either way, these age-old cigars are a solid choice for the medium-bodied smoker.

litto gomez is the masterful genius behind la flor dominicana cigars. suave is a supremely creamy and elegant combination of dominican binder and filler tobaccos beneath a light and satisfying ecuador connecticut wrapper. suave bears faint hints of signature la flor spice with a milder, more approachable profile. leather, nuts and hints of black pepper feature throughout each format. suave is perfect for fans of la flor dominicana looking for a nice mild to medium-bodied blend for earlier in the day. expand your horizons and try the mild, yet complex, suave today!

celebrated artisanal cigar-maker litto gomez blends la flor dominicana reserva especial with an elegantly balanced profile of earthy spices and a toasted creaminess. a peppery ecuador connecticut wrapper cradles a medium-bodied combination of dominican binder and filler tobaccos. reserva especial is characterized by the brand’s hallmark construction and razor sharp burn in every format.

la flor dominicana ligero is a well-rounded lineup of strong, spicy cigars. a beige-hued ecuador sumatra wrapper highlights a spice-laced dominican and nicaraguan filler blend and contributes an earthy character to the predominantly peppery flavor-core. if a solid full-bodied cigar is still a little tame for you, we invite you to try the oscuro-wrapped cigars in this line. these incredibly-dark oscuro wrappers add a very nice, sweet aftertaste to these cigars and also kick the strength up a notch or two.

celebrated boutique cigar-maker litto gomez earned the prestigious ‘#1 cigar of the year’ title from cigar aficionado for 2016 with his 96-rated la flor dominicana andalusian bull. gomez continues his popular small-batch tradition with la flor domincana la volcada, a full-bodied dominican smoke named for a step in the tango. an oily san andrés wrapper embraces complex core of long-filler tobaccos from ecuador and the dominican republic. notes of peppers, espresso beans, molasses, leather, and earth boast a rich and savory finish with exquisite balance.

la flor dominicana la nox is blended by boutique cigar-maker, litto gomez, and is handcrafted in the dominican republic. a hearty brazilian wrapper encloses a full-bodied blend comprised of binder tobaccos from san andrés and dominican long-fillers. a rich profile of earthy flavors offers smooth spices with a leathery finish and a cool burn. la nox is packaged in an artfully designed, circular box adorned with a logo inspired by the paintings of vincent van gogh.

la flor dominicana cigars are created by boutique blending master, litto gomez. known for a robust and spicy profile, double ligero cigars have become phenomenally popular among fans of la flor dominicana. a decadent double-dose of ligero tobaccos rests under a sultry sungrown ecuador wrapper loaded with rich flavors of earth and cedar. peppery nuances build into a chewy full-bodied finish that is best absorbed while sitting down. if you’re looking for an added, over-the-top measure of strength, order one of the maduro sizes. they’re among the boldest cigars available, yet deceptively balanced. smoke one in close proximity to your sofa or a hammock today!

la flor dominicana coronado is blended by the talented, litto gomez, in the dominican republic. cigar aficionado awarded the blend a 93-point score and the ‘#2 cigar of the year’ in 2006. oily, sun-grown nicaraguan wrappers enclose a medium to full-bodied blend of dominican binder and filler tobaccos. rich flavors of leather and caramel reveal complex spices and robust notes of cedar throughout the finish. coronado features seamless construction and is a phenomenal cigar for fans of la flor dominicana and full-flavored profiles from the dominican republic.

la flor dominicana chapter 1 is handmade in the dominican republic by litto gomez. chapter 1 is only available in a chisel shape and utilizes a connecticut broadleaf binder and well-aged dominican filler that are enveloped in dark-brown brazilian wrappers. the flavor is hearty and stimulating. when you first fire up one of these bombshells your palate is immediately flooded with an abundance of flavors including earth, spices and assorted peppers. this cigar remains strong all the way down to the nub, yet retains remarkable balance throughout.

la flor dominicana capitulo ii (which means 'chapter 2') is expertly blended by the masterful, litto gomez, in his state-of-the-art dominican cigar palace. a bold, reddish nicaraguan wrapper pleasantly enrobes an ecuador binder and a dominican filler to present a raisin-like sweetness accented with notes of leather, earth and spices. capitulo ii furnishes a strong conclusion with hints of toast and nuts throughout generous plumes of smoky flavor. hit send and order yours now to find out what happens in la flor's second chapter!

litto gomez pays tribute to his spanish roots with his recent release, la flor dominicana andalusian bull. recipient of an outstanding 96-point rating and cigar aficionado’s coveted ‘#1 cigar of the year’ title for 2016, the blend has captured a remarkable audience. handmade in the dominican republic, andalusian bull combines hand-selected ecuador corojo wrappers with a medium to full-bodied amalgam of proprietary dominican long-filler tobaccos. exceptional flavors of caramel, pepper and leather meld with approachable balance. rich transitions of flavor with a pleasant room note lead to a resplendent finish. add the small-batch la flor dominicana andalusian bull to your cigar collection today.

data.cigar_name: la flor dominicana air bender maduro
data.cigar_description: la flor dominicana has amassed a loyal following of true cigar connoisseurs with a sound offering of complex blends. created by litto gomez in the dominican republic, air bender maduro is handcrafted from a rich ecuador habano maduro wrapper and a medium to full-bodied pairing of dominican binder and filler tobaccos. deep notes of cocoa and smooth spices entice with a touch of earthy sweetness. air bender maduro is perfectly constructed to offer refined and woody aromas in every draw. if you haven’t had one yet, today is a great day to place your order and introduce a captivating new arrival to your humidor!

litto gomez continues to roll out cigars that reside in the realm of the strong and spicy. la flor dominicana air bender earns its hard-hitting name by bringing a medium to full-bodied, spicy smoke to the table. a habano-seed ecuadorian wrapper adds a rich, earthy spiciness to the mix, while the dominican filler blend ushers in a leathery flavor-core and a medley of spices of its own. a heavy aroma of sweet tobacco lingers around the lit end of litto’s productions and enhances the overall flavor of this cigar extremely well.

la flor domincana 1994 commemorates 20 years of continued success for litto gomez. a full-bodied and powerful complexity carries an initial sweet note in each draw. the mexican san andres wrapper surrounds hand-picked, aged dominican binders and fillers to provide a black cherry and spicy kick and finishes with a satisfying clout.

two boutique cigar-makers collaborated to create the small-batch profile of la coalicion. willy herrera of drew estate and jon huber of crowned heads got together to make an uber-boutique cigar drafted from an oily connecticut broadleaf wrapper, an ecuador sumatra binder, and dominican and nicaraguan long-fillers. the intricate, full-bodied blend layers the palate with sweet and earthy tasting notes of hickory, coffee beans, and leather in a handful of classic formats. broaden your boutique horizons with la coalicion today.

data.cigar_name: la aroma del caribe edicion especial
data.cigar_description: originally created for the european market, la aroma del caribe now has limited distribution in the u.s. as well. la aroma del caribe is handmade in pepin garcia's nicaraguan factory exclusively from nicaraguan tobaccos cultivated from first generation cuban seeds. blessed with a potent, and very cuban, spicy earthiness, these cigars also boast supporting notes of nuts, cinnamon and leather. a solid medium to full-bodied smoke, pepin garcia has outdone himself in constructing these beauties, as they're more cubanesque than most cuban cigars on the market today.

la aroma de cuba reserva is finished in a lustrous san andrés oscuro wrapper drawn over a robust blend of premium binder and filler tobaccos grown and blended in nicaragua by award-winning cigar-maker jose ‘pepin’ garcia. oscuro wrappers receive an extended fermentation to achieve their dark and decadent complexion. the san andrés varietal chosen by pepin garcia is harvested from the top priming on the tobacco plant where the leaves are exposed to abundant sunlight and deliver deep, complex flavor as a result. reserva unveils a full-bodied profile of hickory, espresso bean, black pepper, leather, and dark chocolate in six classic sizes aged to deliver peak flavor and aroma. savor a smooth and potent finish in a 94-rated gem from one of nicaragua’s hottest brands today.

la aroma de cuba pasión is blended by award-winning father-and-son cigar-makers pepin and jaime garcia in six exquisite sizes. the finest premium tobaccos grown on prized garcia family estates in estelí, jalapa, and namanji are aged to perfection. pasión boasts a luscious shade grown wrapper harvested in the fertile fields of namanji, where tobacco plants flourish in a unique microclimate of warm days and cool nights 18 miles east of estelí. shade grown wrapper is planted on over one-third of the garcias’ private 300-acre estate where the crops are shielded from direct sunlight and nourished by the basin’s snaking river. savor an all-new nicaraguan masterpiece with notes of smoked cashew, leather, cedar, and molasses today!

la aroma de cuba noblesse is an exclusive release blended by legendary cigar-maker jose 'pepin' garcia. noblesse is comprised entirely of long-filler tobaccos from the garcia family's farms in three of nicaragua's key growing regions: estelí, jalapa, and namanji. the result is a stunning blend of aged tobaccos enveloped in habano and criollo double binders finished in a silky and luxuriant habano rosado wrapper grown in ecuador. noblesse boasts hearty notes of almond, nougat, cedar, and spice in a medium to full-bodied profile that layers the palate throughout a creamy finale. indulge in la aroma de cuba noblesse in a coveted collection handcrafted in small batches in estelí, nicaragua.

data.cigar_name: la aroma de cuba mi amor
data.cigar_description: la aroma de cuba mi amor is a critically acclaimed, 95-rated masterpiece and recipient of cigar aficionado’s ‘#2 cigar of the year’ honors. blended by legendary cigar-maker jose ‘pepin’ garcia in estelí, nicaragua, mi amor is handmade from a dark and decadent san andrés wrapper leaf over a vintage interior of premium nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos. among the first cigar-makers to establish the san andrés wrapper as a world-renowned varietal, pepin garcia set the benchmark high with mi amor’s versatile profile of dark chocolate, almond, espresso bean, and cracked black pepper. hints of coconut emerge before a sweet and zesty finish rounds out this hearty classic in several popular sizes. savor la aroma de cuba mi amor without delay.

data.cigar_name: la aroma de cuba edicion especial
data.cigar_description: la aroma de cuba edicion especial is blended by celebrated cigar-maker jose ‘pepin’ garcia in estelí, nicaragua, from a lustrous ecuador habano wrapper leaf, primed from the upper section of the plant. inside is a classic blend of binder and filler tobaccos grown on select garcia family estates in nicaragua’s key tobacco-growing regions: estelí, jalapa, and namanji. edicion especial delivers a medium to full-bodied profile of smoked almond, cocoa, leather, and coffee bean notes with an abundant spice followed by a zesty, cubanesque finish. edicion especial was rated 94 points and ranked as a ‘top 5’ cigar by cigar aficionado following its premiere. relish a nicaraguan classic in six traditional shapes.

savor a stunning new cigar from an iconic cuban-legacy portfolio with la aroma de cuba connecticut. world-renowned cigar-makers pepin and jaime garcia add an entirely new dimension to a prestigious nicaraguan brand with the creamy and mellow profile of la aroma de cuba connecticut cigars. a butterscotch-hued ecuador connecticut wrapper embraces the finest nicaraguan long-fillers, grown on select garcia family estates, following a patient triple fermentation. luscious notes of almond, cedar, cashew, and coffee bean impart hints of buttercream in seven popular sizes. la aroma de cuba connecticut is destined to impress new cigar lovers and discerning connoisseurs around the world. add an approachable and sophisticated classic to your humidor without delay.

la aroma de cuba originated in cuba where it became a favorite brand of winston churchill in the late 1800s. reborn in nicaragua in the house of legendary cigar-maker jose ‘pepin’ garcia in estelí, nicaragua, la aroma de cuba has grown into a mega-brand and one of the hottest cigars on the market. a toothy connecticut broadleaf wrapper is drawn over a vintage amalgam of premium nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos grown on garcia family estates and aged to perfection. tasting notes of cocoa, cedar, molasses, and earth, converge with balanced spices before a voluptuous, medium-bodied finish coats the palate. the critics at cigar aficionado awarded la aroma de cuba with an impressive 93-point rating and declared it the ‘#1 cigar industry best buy in the world’ following its revival more than two decades ago. savor a must-have cigar for new cigar lovers and seasoned connoisseurs everywhere.

la antiguedad is diligently crafted from a well-aged assembly of all-nicaraguan core components grown on farms privately owned by the garcia family and enrobed in a pristine, mouthwatering ecuadorian habano wrapper leaf. the end result is a spectacular full-bodied smoking experience highlighted by decadent notes of english toffee, cedar and leather.

kristoff vengeance revisits a popular blend originally released in 2011. in the present edition, an oily connecticut broadleaf wrapper leaf marries a medium to full-bodied blend of dominican, nicaraguan, and indonesian binder and filler tobaccos. notes of espresso beans, graham cracker, and cayenne display a hint of sweetness in a handful of classic shapes handmade in the dominican republic.

kristoff sumatra delivers a medium to full-bodied profile of cedar, herbs, and spices with a leathery texture. handcrafted in the dominican republic, an oily and vibrant ecuador sumatra wrapper leaf harbors a rich, complex core of dominican, nicaraguan, and brazilian long-filler tobaccos in a handful slightly thicker shapes. save big by picking up boutique smokes like kristoff sumatra when you’re craving cigars that burn cool and even with an intense but balanced finish. the brand’s small-batch signature includes 20-count rustic boxes packed with loose tobaccos throughout a hearty, zesty dominican portfolio.

kristoff shade grown cigars deliver a robust and creamy foundation of hazelnut, toast, almond, and coffee with ample spices from beginning to end. a unique connecticut-seed shade grown wrapper cultivated in honduras embraces a flavorful core of cuban-seed binder and filler tobaccos grown in the dominican republic and nicaragua. kristoff shade grown is handmade in the dominican republic and adds new dimensions of taste and aroma to the brand’s rustic small-batch portfolio for a solid value.

enjoy the medium to full-bodied profile kristoff san andres presents with a rich and complex combination of tobaccos. cuban-seed binders grown in ecuador rest alongside nicaraguan filler tobaccos beneath a succulent san andres wrapper. pronounced notes of coffee, cream, earth and black pepper reveal an enticing sweetness characteristic of the blend’s oily wrapper leaf. handcrafted with patient attention, each cool, approachable draw offers a generous marriage of sweet and spicy flavors that resonate down to the nub.

top-rated boutique cigar brand kristoff deploys a play on words with its kristoff pistoff release. a meaty, full-bodied profile of toasted spices, molasses, and coffee bean notes boasts a touch of sweetness towards the finish with plenty of peppery zest in advance. handmade in the dominican republic, kristoff pistoff is crafted from a san andrés wrapper leaf over an indonesian binder and nicaraguan filler tobaccos. kristoff fans who crave a more full-flavored smoke kicked up with an added blast of strength should give kristoff pistoff a shot today. a handful of bigger ring gauge shapes are loaded with potent complexity.

kristoff maduro is a medium-bodied, dominican-made cigar. featuring an oily, brazilian wrapper, these cigars contain a rich blend of dominican and nicaraguan tobaccos. the flavors are rich and earthy offering chewy notes of cedar, pepper and espresso. well-balanced, smooth and flavorful, kristoff maduro is an enjoyable cigar from start to finish.

kristoff ligero maduro contains 3 times the amount of ligero as the regular kristoff maduro. handmade in the dominican republic, these ligero-laden lovelies brandish dark, oily brazilian wrappers and a bullish blend of dominican and nicaraguan tobaccos. full-bodied in strength, kristoff ligero maduro is richly-flavored exhibiting notes of earth, toast, roasted espresso bean and sweet cocoa – all via a smooth, balanced delivery.

kristoff kristania maduro cigars deliver a medium-bodied profile of fresh ground coffee, cocoa, and pepper before a long medium-bodied finish resonates in a handful of classic kristoff sizes. an oily brazilian maduro wrapper leaf encapsulates a hearty blend of cuban-seed long-fillers cultivated in the dominican republic. add a rustic box of classic kristoff smokes to your collection for a great price when you’re craving the distinctive, sweet, and earthy spice of a dark brazilian wrapper.

kristoff kristania is handcrafted in the dominican republic from an oily nicaraguan criollo wrapper leaf over a beefy blend of cuban-seed long-fillers grown in the dominican republic. a balanced profile of espresso, cocoa, and pepper blesses the palate with hints of vanilla and baking spices before a naturally sweet, medium to full-bodied finish culminates. kristoff kristania cigars come in rustic 20-count boxes you can add to your coolerdor for a decent price. taste another small-batch gem from kristoff when you’re in search of a consistent smoke to supplement your weekly rotation.

kristoff habano delivers a satisfying peppery kick with a unique, multi-national blend handcrafted in the dominican republic. a cuban-seed brazilian wrapper embraces brazilian binders over dominican and nicaraguan filler tobaccos. flavors of sweet cedar and coffee rush through the nose with an approachable aroma. the medium-bodied profile develops a spicy undertone and finishes with a balanced complexity.

an earthy reddish-brown wrapper grown in brazil is crafted with a signature pigtail cap over a complex core of dominican, nicaraguan, and honduran long-fillers in kristoff’s gc signature series. the 91-rated blend is handmade in the dominican republic and rumored to be a favorite of brand owner glen case. tasting notes of molasses, leather, hay, and licorice converge in a handful of shapes made with kristoff’s well-known shaggy foot. the finish is full-bodied.

an oily cuban-seed nicaraguan criollo wrapper leaf conceals a hearty interior of dominican and nicaraguan tobaccos in kristoff criollo. medium to full-bodied notes of chestnuts, cedar, cashews, and black pepper accompany an earthy finish that is both smooth and zesty. kristoff is handcrafted in the dominican republic by seasoned makers of small-batch boutique smokes. fans of more full-bodied, spicier cigars prefer kristoff for its consistent, even-burning construction, complex flavor, and everyday rock-bottom prices. value and taste converge in a handmade boutique that’s easy to stockpile in your coolerdor. kristoff is outfitted in a rustic presentation with a cushion of loose tobaccos inside boxes that display a vintage look.

kristoff corojo limitada is handmade in the dominican republic, using double and triple fermented cuban-seed tobaccos. nicaraguan and dominican binder and fillers are enrobed in a shimmering corojo wrapper that combine to create a medium to full-bodied smoke that offers up flavors of spice, nutmeg and nuts.

boutique cigar brand kristoff takes its well-known formula for blending beefier smokes down a notch to deliver added approachability in kristoff connecticut. an ecuador connecticut wrapper blankets a rich and nutty core of dominican and nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos handcrafted in the dominican republic in a handful of thicker ring gauges that burn cool and easy. notes of cashews, almonds, and coffee with cream display a silky and moderate spice you can enjoy almost any time of the day. kristoff cigars are shipped in rustic boxes packed with a cushion of loose tobaccos for gentle transport and a touch of extra complexity as the cigars age.

top ratings have been commonplace for kristoff ever since the brand debuted back in 2004. kristoff cameroon continues the brand’s small-batch boutique tradition by packing cigars on a bed of loose tobaccos inside rustic boxes. a 7-year aged cameroon wrapper leaf embraces a medium to full-bodied core of long-filler tobaccos from the dominican republic and nicaragua. ample ring gauges deliver cool-burning notes of cedar, wood, baking spices, almonds and leather. indulge in the complex, spicy and sweet profile only an authentic cameroon wrapper leaf provides with kristoff cameroon today.

the small-batch masters at crowned heads follow up their previous jericho hill release with a new addition, juarez, a medium to full-bodied nicaraguan handmade. an oily san andrés wrapper leaf embraces a hearty core of dominican and nicaraguan long-fillers tucked inside an ecuador sumatra binder. a meaty profile of wood, leather, and peppers emanates with a smoky campfire aroma before a chewy, earthy finish sets in. like jericho hill, juarez is named for lyrics in the classic johnny cash song, “cocaine blues.” clear out some space in your coolerdor for top-notch boutiques from crowned heads.

joya de nicaragua is among nicaragua’s oldest contemporary cigar brands. joya de nicaragua cigars debuted in 1968. in 2018, the company marked its 50th anniversary and joya de nicaragua silver was blended to commemorate the occasion. a cuban-seed wrapper grown in ecuador encapsulates an eventful blend of binder and filler tobaccos cultivated in nicaragua and mexico’s noted tobacco-growing region, san andrés. notes of cocoa, pepper, dried fruit, and nuts culminate in an earthy medium-bodied finish.

data.cigar_name: joya de nicaragua antano dark corojo
data.cigar_description: joya de nicaragua is known for manufacturing some of the strongest cigars on the market. however, this may be their strongest cigar to date… handmade in nicaragua, joya de nicaragua antano dark corojo (that’s a mouthful) features outrageously-dark corojo wrappers draped around a spice-bound blend of all-nicaraguan long-fillers. full-bodied in strength, these cigars boast an intense dose of black pepper paired with explosive layers of earth and cedar.

joya de nicaragua antano is one of the strongest cigars on the market. handmade in nicaragua from 100% nicaraguan tobaccos, these spice-bombs really pack a punch. full-bodied in strength, these cigars boast a hefty, earthy flavor-core enhanced by notes of cedar and espresso which explode into a myriad of spices on the finish. consuming a full meal should be considered a prerequisite to smoking one of these steroidal cigars.

jericho hill is a small production cigar from the crowned heads crew out of nashville, tennessee. manufactured in estelí, nicaragua, jericho hill is composed using nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos along with a dark san andres maduro wrapper. medium to full-bodied, these cigars feature a robust and earthy flavor-core embellished by hints of nuts and leather. with a box-pressed finish and rustic presentation, jericho hill pays homage to country music legend, johnny cash.

java red adds dashes of cherry flavor to the wildly popular coffee-infused profile of the original java blend. a lush connecticut broadleaf wrapper conceals an all-nicaraguan amalgam of binder and filler tobaccos that deliver a blissfully sweet finish. choose from a handful of classic java formats when your sweet tooth for fine cigar acts up, or you’re looking for an ideal blend to pair with dessert or an after-dinner drink. creamy notes of coffee, chocolate and cherries mesmerize the palate from start to finish.

java mint is the newest extension to the java line of cigars rolled  by the folks at drew estate exclusively for rocky patel.  java mint is a  decadent blend of rich, dark chocolate and mint flavorings added to a  select mellow blend of naturally sweet tobaccos.  java mint actually  tastes the way it smells; sweet, flavorful and reminiscent of an ice  cream parlor!

thanks to the mad minds at drew estate, rocky patel's java latte is a wonderful concoction of sweet cream, mocha and a lovely buttery flavor with hints of coffee. these flavored beauts sell out pretty quickly so if you see them in-stock, don’t hesitate to get yourself a box.

java is a coffee-infused cigar manufactured by drew estate for rocky patel. handmade using a dark, connecticut broadleaf wrapper and a tasty blend of all-nicaraguan long-fillers, java cigars feature a unique flavor-infusion of coffee and mocha. these cigars boast a sweet, scrumptious flavor bouquet blessed with rich notes of earth, dark chocolate and espresso.

when it comes to jalopy, there’s not a whole lot to brag about. manufactured in the dominican, these cigars are finished in a connecticut wrapper with a mellow blend of all-dominican tobaccos tucked inside. the strength is mild while the flavors are nonchalant and fairly uneventful. look on the bright side, they burn straight and taste decent, and you’re only dropping a few bucks when you scoop up a reliable 20-count bundle of 7-by-50 churchills. these budget-friendly yard ‘gars are nothing to be embarrassed by when they get you from point a to point b on the lawnmower.

award-winning father-and-son cigar-makers jose ‘pepin’ garcia and jaime garcia have created some of the highest-rated and most sought-after cigars over the last two decades with their my father brand. jaime’s influence on the pair’s success is significant as his father’s right-hand man across their farming operations to their state-of-the-art factory floor. his eponymous jaime garcia reserva especial blend is proof the apple doesn’t fall far from the tree. a glistening connecticut broadleaf wrapper conceals a marvelous and meaty core of well-aged nicaraguan long-fillers harvested on select garcia family estates. a full-bodied profile of leather, dark cocoa, black pepper, and earth resonates in a collection of balanced and delicious sizes. savor a sweet and zesty classic from the garcias today.

data.cigar_name: isla del sol by drew estate
data.cigar_description: isla del sol is a value-priced, coffee-infused cigar by drew estate. handmade in nicaragua, these beauties feature a nice blend of sandwich tobaccos infused with exotic sumatran coffee bean. the flavors are rich and creamy boasting luscious notes of coffee and mocha. the sugar-dunked tip adds an extra layer of sweetness to this scrumptious, aromatic offering.

data.cigar_name: intemperance ba xxi by roma craft
data.cigar_description: from roma craft tobac, intemperance ba xxi is manufactured in estelí, nicaragua. ba refers to the brazilian arapiraca wrapper which rests over a multi-national combination of filler components. notes of leather, cedar and cocoa profile well. intemperance is a small production brand that features a snake logo and an oaky finish.

illusione is a small-batch boutique brand created by dion giolito who often references his fascination with conspiracy theories throughout his cigar portfolio. among his more popular blends are illusione rothchildes and illusione 88. a lustrous san andrés wrapper leaf blankets a meaty core of all-nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos in illusione rothchildes to deliver a profile of earth, leather, nuts, and baking spices, handcrafted in nicaragua. illusione 88 is handmade in honduras from a reddish-brown rosado wrapper leaf over a potent but balanced recipe of nicaraguan long-fillers in a bold display of wood, cocoa, black pepper, leather, and coffee beans.

data.cigar_name: hoyo de monterrey la amistad silver
data.cigar_description: popular cigar-maker aj fernandez delivers an addition to the acclaimed cuban-legacy hoyo de monterrey franchise with la amistad silver. an ecuador habano wrapper leaf embraces a full-bodied profile of leather, cedar and cayenne pepper with a touch of sweetness around the edges. choose from a handful of classic sizes and indulge in the evolution of the hoyo de monterrey portfolio with a handcrafted nicaraguan gem.

data.cigar_name: hoyo de monterrey la amistad black
data.cigar_description: boutique cigar-making sensation aj fernandez has been delivering one hit after the next for iconic cuban-legacy brands like hoyo de monterrey. the full-bodied profile of hoyo de monterrey la amistad black shows off his handiwork with spicy notes of cayenne, leather, and cinnamon with a plentiful and peppery zest. a dark brown ecuador sumatra wrapper leaf encapsulates a complex core of long-filler tobaccos from nicaragua and san andrés. hoyo de monterrey la amistad black is handmade in a handful of classic shapes at aj’s factory in estelí, nicaragua. add a new take on a cuban-heritage brand to your collection today.

hoyo de monterrey la amistad presents the talents of a.j. fernandez in a 90-rated cuban-heritage blend that swells with a full-bodied profile of cocoa, walnuts and leather. four major growing regions in nicaragua represent a complex core of long-filler tobaccos beneath an oily ecuador habano wrapper leaf. dried fruit and sumptuous spices characterize a chewy and nutty finish.

hoyo de monterrey is an old-time cuban-heritage brand handcrafted in honduras. a complex blend of nicaraguan, honduran, and cuban-seed long-fillers grown in the dominican republic lie inside a connecticut binder. the blend is finished in your choice of an ecuador sumatra (natural) wrapper or a connecticut broadleaf (maduro). nutty notes of leather, wood, grass, and spices tempt the palate with a touch of cocoa in a handful of traditional formats. a medium to full-bodied finish lingers on the palate with a zesty aftertaste. add a box of hoyo de monterrey to your man cave when you need a recognizable cuban-legacy brand you can hand out to your pals without breaking the bank.

data.cigar_name: herrera esteli norteno by drew estate
data.cigar_description: drew estate’s boutique blending sensation willy herrera adds to the company’s non-infused franchise with a full-bodied nicaraguan smoke drafted from a rich combination of nicaraguan and honduran long-fillers beneath a hearty san andrés wrapper leaf. the small-batch cigar is crafted in a handful of soft box-pressed shapes that deliver a solid profile of cocoa, nougat, and sweet notes of cedar with a creamy, dense finish. herrera estelí norteno scored 94 points and a ‘top 10’ ranking from cigar aficionado back in 2016.

data.cigar_name: herrera esteli maduro by drew estate
data.cigar_description: as drew estate’s chief blender of non-infused boutique smokes, willy herrera created herrera estelí maduro from a toothy brazilian wrapper leaf and a complex core of connecticut broaleaf binders and nicaraguan fillers. the medium to full-bodied profile delivers sweet, earthy, and floral notes of dark chocolate, fresh ground coffee and spices. choose from a handful of popular shapes when you’re looking to add more small-batch smokes to your collection.

data.cigar_name: herrera esteli habano by drew estate
data.cigar_description: an oily cuban-seed wrapper leaf grown in ecuador embraces a bountiful core of nicaraguan and honduran long-filler tobaccos in herrera estelí habano. the blend arrives from the fellas at drew estate who continue to add to the brand’s boutique franchise with a variety of complex, small-batch gems. herrera estelí habano delivers a medium to full-bodied profile of cedar, coffee with cream, roasted almonds and a zesty finish. following its debut, the brand scored a 94-point rating and a ‘top 25’ ranking from cigar aficionado.

get a ton of bone for your buck with herfdog, a dominican-made boutique bundle available in three classic shapes. a succulent sumatra wrapper leaf embraces a premium cuban-sandwich blend of nicaraguan and honduran filler tobaccos that beam with consistent flavor at rock-bottom prices that won’t break the bank. notes of coffee beans and baking spices with a touch of cocoa deliver the perfect ratio of peppery, earthy flavor. herfdog is the ticket for your next yard ‘gar or anytime you’re in need of handouts when the man cave gets overrun by a crowd of cigar-pilfering pals.

henry clay cigars are easy to recognize due to their rugged, haggard-looking wrappers. without getting into too much detail, let’s just say that these aren’t the prettiest cigars you’ll ever smoke. regardless, they are well-blended and feature a rich concoction of dominican tobaccos topped off with connecticut broadleaf wrappers. the strength is medium-bodied, while the flavors are rich and leathery with a hint of creamy sweetness thanks to the broadleaf wrapper.

rich and woody flavors emerge in the classic cuban legacy profile of h. upmann vintage cameroon. a reddish-hued cameroon wrapper embraces a complex core of dominican, nicaraguan, and peruvian long-filler tobaccos in a medium-bodied smoke that exhibits notes of chestnuts, cashews, coffee beans, and sweet spices. choose from a comprehensive menu of classic shapes when you’re craving a cigar that fits in before or after dinner. share h. upmann vintage cameroon with your pals down in the man cave thanks to its easygoing, iconic flavor and an affordable price point.

h. upmann is among the oldest cigar brands in existence, originally founded by german banker, herman upmann. to commemorate its lineage dating back to cuba more than 170 years ago, the h. upmann brand introduced the banker with a succulent, oily ecuador habano wrapper over a spicy combination of long-fillers from nicaragua and the dominican republic. the legendary, premium blend is handcrafted in the dominican republic. a medium to full-bodied profile presents earthy flavors of black pepper with a creamy finish. make a robust and rewarding deposit in your humidor by ordering the banker today!

iconic cuban-legacy brand h. upmann delivers a rich and mellow profile courtesy of the company’s esteemed master cigar-makers known as ‘group de maestros.’ h. upmann connecticut is handcrafted in the dominican republic from a golden-blond ecuador connecticut wrapper leaf over a creamy interior of dominican and nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos. the head of every cigar is finished in a dark, maduro cap for a vivid visual contrast. notes of almonds, cashews, cedar, and black pepper lead to a sumptuous finish in a handful of traditional shapes. taste an approachable, medium-bodied take on a classic brand as imagined by a well-known collective of veteran cigar-makers.

h. upmann aj fernandez delivers a medium to full-bodied nicaraguan profile named for, and blended by, the increasingly popular cigar-maker. notes of cedar, cinnamon, almonds, coffee beans and rich spices deliver complex flavor and a luscious aroma. an ecuador sumatra wrapper embraces an eventful combination of nicaraguan and dominican long-filler tobaccos. taste a new take on a storied cuban-legacy brand by a hot cigar-maker today.

h. upmann 1844 reserve is a tad bit spicier and slightly more full-bodied than the traditional h. upmann.  to achieve a fuller body, a  rich, choice ecuadorian wrapper was draped over top of a somewhat spicy  nicaraguan binder and an interesting blend of well-aged dominican  fillers.  the result could quite possibly be the finest cigar bearing  the h. upmann name.

bargain fiends addicted to the everyday discounts the gran habano brand boasts can add a stellar variety to their daily rotation with the vintage habano 2006 blend. a full-flavored profile delivers mild to medium-bodied notes of toasted almonds, leather and blonde roast coffee. handcrafted in honduras from a gingerbread-hued ecuador habano wrapper over filler tobaccos from nicaragua and costa rica, gran habano vintage 2006 is another tough-to-beat release when you require quality, consistency and balance at rock-bottom prices.

an authentic connecticut shade wrapper cradles a complex combination of nicaraguan and costa rican tobaccos in a blissful, mild to medium-bodied profile handcrafted in honduras for an amazing value in gran habano vintage connecticut 2004. flawless construction, awe-inspiring aroma and mouthwatering flavors of toasted nuts and leather deliver a complementary spice at rock-bottom prices gran habano fans have been applauding for years. savor a great deal in a handful of classic and consistent shapes.

get 90-rated cigars without digging deep into your pocketbook for medium to full-bodied flavors with gran habano vintage corojo 2002. chocolate-hued nicaraguan corojo wrappers marry a splendid blend of nicaraguan and costa rican long-filler tobaccos to offer a pleasant punch with a balanced profile. notes of cedar, coffee, earth and spices reveal a nutty finish. an enticing aroma and sound construction amply increase the street value of these boomsticks, but luckily the price you’re getting them for is every bit as palatable as their juicy texture.

george rico has crafted dozens and dozens of cigars under his esteemed gran habano brand. for fans of rico’s work, gran habano habano #3 will surely not disappoint. a zesty combination of habano wrappers over a delicious mixture of long-fillers from nicaragua, costa rica and san andrés delivers a solid medium to full-bodied profile. rich, earthy spices with approachable flavors of cedar and leather brim with big aromas in every format. grab a box of gran habano habano #3 for your next coolerdor replenishment!

fans of hearty honduran cigars get an extra dose of sweet spices in gran habano corojo maduro #5. brand owner george rico blends a classic combination of nicaraguan and costa rican long-filler tobaccos beneath a dark and oily maduro wrapper leaf. tasting notes of chestnuts, cayenne pepper, coffee beans, and dark chocolate emerge in a handful of traditional shapes. add full-bodied boutiques to your coolerdor for a mouthwatering value from gran habano.

gran habano corojo #5 is a well-made cigar hailing from honduras. crafted by the father and son team of guillermo and george rico, these cigars pack lots of bang for your buck. oily, reddish-hued nicaraguan wrappers embrace a robust blend of nicaraguan and costa rican tobaccos. fiery and full-bodied, these budget-friendly beauts boast rich notes of earth, cedar, spice and leather.

as the head of gran habano, george rico has blended a milder cigar with the connecticut #1. handcrafted in honduras, smooth and silky ecuador connecticut wrappers merge a balanced combination of nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos. a delicate nuttiness offers hints of coffee and toasted leather with a creamy finish. connecticut #1 reveals an approachable finish that settles in the mild to medium-bodied vicinity of strength. for fans of gran habano looking for a mid-morning snack, connecticut #1 is a great option.

golden hour is drawn from an oily sun grown wrapper and a premium cuban-sandwich blend of dominican tobaccos in a classic 6-by-50 toro. tasting notes of cedar, leather, and spice layer the palate in a sequence of cool and easy draws before a nutty mild to medium-bodied finish lingers. grab a 20-count bundle of golden hour and save big when you’re in search of an affordable high-quality blend you can savor any time of the day.

the god of fire serie aniversario is a super-premium, limited-edition blend created by carlito fuente. the serie aniversario commemorates the brand’s 10th anniversary. handcrafted in the dominican republic, god of fire boasts deep, oily ecuador wrappers over an aged blend of the finest dominican binder and filler tobaccos. perfectly constructed, cool draws deliver indulgent notes of wood, leather, figs and dense spices with a powerful and tantalizing finish. delicious, delicate and rare form an accurate characterization of the medium-bodied profile. god of fire is a top-shelf addition to any humidor and is a superb offering when you’re celebrating a special occasion, or you wish to impress the most knowledgeable cigar connoisseur you know.

gispert is a perfect cigar for connoisseurs in search of a nicely priced option who can’t decide if they want something stronger or milder. the straight-up medium-bodied profile is handmade in honduras with a silky ecuador connecticut wrapper over a tasteful mixture of honduran and nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos. buttery notes of white pepper with hints of caramel and light cocoa segue into a satisfying woody finish. impress your cigar-mooching pals when they get into your humidor by keeping a stash of gispert on hand at all times. our modest prices on gispert makes adding them to the cart a snap!

data.cigar_name: fuente fuente opus x lost city
data.cigar_description: the opus x lost city is a very rare and well-aged blend comprised entirely of dominican tobaccos grown on the fuente family’s famous chateau de la fuente estate. rich and oily dominican wrappers enclose a robust pairing of dominican binder and filler tobaccos which deliver bold, balanced flavors of leather, cedar and oak with amplified spices and a creamy finish. for fans of fuente, opus x lost city is a special occasion blend with added complexity and an intriguing depth.

savor a small-batch profile from four kicks with the mule kick limited edition 2022. mule kick is an annual limited release from the fellas at four kicks. the latest rendition of mule kick is handcrafted at ernesto perez-carrillo’s factory in the dominican republic from a hearty blend of premium nicaraguan long-fillers under an oily and glimmering wrapper leaf from san andrés. notes of mesquite, raisin, and wood complement a formidable spice with underlying hints of tea. a long and complex finish of nuts, oak, and molasses layers the palate with a peppery aftertaste. procure a box before the latest small-batch gems from four kicks are long gone, friends.

four kicks is a brand new small batch boutique cigar distributed by crowned heads. founded by former cao employees after a corporate re-structuring, crowned heads decided to develop a cigar that they could blend and call their own so they reached out to the one and only ernesto perez-carrillo to get things exactly where they wanted. hailing from the dominican republic, this medium bodied cigar is rolled and blended under excellent supervision and comprised of top-notch, well-aged nicaraguan fillers and binders with a gorgeous habano wrapper. try one just for kicks but we promise that you'll be hooked and enjoy each and everyone one.

flor de oliva maduro cigars hail from the award-winning oliva brand in estelí, nicaragua, where they’re handmade in delicious and affordable 20-count bundles. a dark and toothy maduro wrapper leaf surrounds an excellent blend of well-aged nicaraguan long-fillers in four classic sizes. tasting notes of dark chocolate, coffee bean, and pepper layer the palate before a medium-bodied finish resonates. flor de oliva maduro is the perfect blend when you’re craving a high-quality but inexpensive everyday cigar you can smoke casually while you’re mowing the grass. add a bundle to the coolerdor today.

if ‘creamy, refined, and doesn’t cost a fortune’ are at the top of your everyday cigar requirements, catapult flor de oliva gold to the top of your shopping list. handmade in the prestigious oliva factory in estelí, nicaragua, flor de oliva gold boasts marvelous flavor and construction for pennies on the dollar. toasted notes of nuts and coffee with cream produce a dash of spices in four classic shapes you can count on for a reliable yard ‘gar or campfire smoke when you’re hoofing it through some rough terrain. modest prices and a mellow finish make it easy to appease cigar-pilfering pals who’ve got their hands out the second the room note hits the air.

mmm. mmm. a little spice is nice when you can get it from a national top-selling brand like oliva in a tidy bundle at rock-bottom prices. you don’t have to spend big when you’re craving consistent flavor in an everyday smoke from a recognized brand. flor de oliva corojo delivers the goods with an all nicaraguan core of handmade long-fillers beneath a reddish-hued corojo wrapper leaf that beams with plenty of pepper in a handful of iconic shapes. spicy notes of chestnuts and earth meld in a profile that makes for a great man cave handout when your pals come down with a charity-case mentality on poker night.

flor de oliva cigars come in high-quality, affordable 20-count bundles handmade at the award-winning oliva factory in estelí, nicaragua. long before oliva won the prestigious ‘#1 cigar of the year’ honors in cigar aficionado, the company became well known for producing several extremely popular bundles. flor de oliva is blended from a toasty brown sumatra wrapper leaf over a sumptuous core of nicaraguan long-fillers in a medium-bodied profile. tasting notes of wood, earth, and coffee bean mingle perfectly in four classic shapes that make for great utility smokes when you’re mowing the lawn or waxing the station wagon. the finish is dang tasty for the buck. top off the coolerdor with an inexpensive bundle from the world-renowned oliva brand today.

the original flor de las antillas received a 96-rating and won the ‘#1 cigar of the year’ award from cigar aficionado in 2012. jose ‘pepin’ garcia presents the original all-nicaraguan cigar with an all-new and lustrous ecuador habano maduro wrapper leaf. handcrafted in pepin’s magnificent my father factory in estelí, nicaragua, antillas maduro presents indulgent flavors of cocoa, spices, wood and dried fruit with a balanced intensity. fans of the original flor de las antillas are sure to enjoy the additional depth and sweetness available in the medium to full-bodied profile.

flor de las antillas 10th anniversary is a limited-edition cigar blended to commemorate a decade of the original flor de las antillas, one of the biggest hits from the my father brand. when flor de las antillas debuted in 2012, the critics in cigar aficionado awarded it 96 points with their coveted ‘#1 cigar of the year’ title. the cigar represented a major milestone and highlighted the immense talents of expatriate cuban cigar-maker josé ‘pepin’ garica, who left his native country and started over with his family in the states in the early 2000s. flor de las antillas cigars are blended entirely from premium nicaraguan tobaccos grown on select garcia family estates, and the 10th anniversary is curated from an especially rare recipe. a darker and stronger nicaraguan wrapper is harvested from a higher priming, while the interior tobaccos have been modified in a 6.5-by-52 toro. add this savory and oily smoke to your collection before they sell out. only 5,000 boxes were produced, and we anticipate they won’t last long!

flor de las antillas received a 96-point rating and cigar aficionado’s coveted ‘#1 cigar of the year’ ranking when it debuted in 2012. legendary father-and-son cigar-makers pepin and jaime garcia blend flor de las antillas from the finest nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos tucked under an oily, reddish-brown sun grown nicaraguan wrapper in a series of soft-box-pressed sizes. enchanting notes of cayenne pepper, cedar, nutmeg, and cinnamon mingle in a savory and zesty profile with a medium to full-bodied finish. flor de las antillas means “flower of the antilles,” and is a reference to the garcia family’s native cuba, where their cigar-making journey took root generations ago.

dedicated to the thriftiest fishermen who smoke cigars, fine catch displays all the hallmarks of a high-quality, creamy and mild handmade for a fraction of the price. fine catch cigars are handcrafted in the dominican republic from a blend of vintage dominican long-fillers tucked inside your choice of two distinctive wrappers. tasting notes of cedar, blonde roast coffee, and buttered toast coat the palate with luscious, easygoing flavor in the connecticut shade (natural) wrapper. in the sumatra (maduro) blend, a sublime sequence of woody, earthy, and zesty notes teases the senses with traces of leather and baking spices. reel in budget-friendly bundles of fine catch for the lowest prices in the industry before they get away, friends!

if you're a fan of full-bodied cigars, then look no further than pete johnson's fausto. manufactured by jose ’pepin’ garcia, this brawny blend gets its strength from a heavy-handed inclusion of ligero tobaccos from jalapa and estelí and is finished off with a smooth and oily ecuador habano wrapper. although fausto is decidedly full-bodied with a heavy dose of peppery-spice, it’s not overwhelming or one-dimensional by any means. as the cigar burns down, a lovely dark sweetness with a hint of fennel develops that is both intriguing and interesting.

excalibur has been a staple in the cigar industry for decades. handmade in honduras, these cigars boast an eclectic 4-country blend along with beautiful connecticut wrappers. medium to full-bodied in strength, excalibur yields a woody flavor laced with notes of earth, toast and cream. available in natural and maduro wrappers, excalibur cigars are well-made and very consistent.

el rico habano is an old-time flavor-bomb hailing from the dominican republic. handmade utilizing ecuadorian wrappers and a beefy blend of all-nicaraguan long-fillers, these cigars certainly pack a punch. full-bodied in strength, el rico habano offers zesty notes of spice, earth and leather for a nice value.

el rey del mundo is an old-time brand with a loyal fan-following. handmade in honduras, these flavor-bombs feature a rich blend of dominican and nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos under a connecticut broadleaf wrapper. medium to full-bodied in strength, these cigars offer simple notes of earth and spice for a solid value.

el güegüense [el way-when-say], meaning “the wise man,” was one of the first cigars from the foundation cigar company and brand founder nick melillo to create a stir when it debuted in 2015. originally from connecticut, melillo honed his craft working at drew estate in a variety of roles before he branched out to create his own brand, foundation cigars. el güegüense is handmade in esteli, nicaragua, from a formidable blend of nicaraguan tobaccos. a reddish-brown nicaraguan corojo ’99 wrapper leaf harbors nicaraguan corojo and criollo long-fillers matured for a considerable period. tasting notes of cedar, paprika, earth, and leather layer the palate with hints of baking spices. the critics in cigar aficionado rated el güegüense 92 points and slotted in their list of the ‘top 25’ cigars for 2016.

el centurion h-2k-ct is an exceptional offering blended by jose ‘pepin’ garcia. h-2k-ct refers to the wrapper which is a sungrown cuban-seed varietal grown in connecticut. the unique wrapper covers an elegant pairing of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos grown by the garcia family. a medium-bodied profile with notes of cedar, honey, nuts and creamy spices provides a luscious finish. el centurion h-2k-ct is handmade at the my father cigars factory in estelí, nicaragua. try a magnificent extension of the el centurion line with h-2k-ct today!

el centurion is a superb cigar manufactured in nicaragua by jose 'pepin' garcia. lovely nicaraguan wrappers marry a bodacious blend of lush nicaraguan tobaccos that produce a flavor and aroma that are dually exquisite. rich notes of earth and cedar accompany intricacies of oak, nutmeg and brown sugar from beginning to end.

behold cigar aficionado’s ‘#1 cigar of the year’ for 2020: e.p. carrillo pledge. master cigar-maker ernesto perez-carrillo has scored numerous hits with his eponymous brand. as the man behind the original la gloria cubana franchise, perez-carrillo has been well known to cigar lovers everywhere for decades. his lengthy list of critical accolades culminates in e.p. carrillo pledge, his second cigar to score a coveted ‘cigar of the year’ title. what makes it so great? well, before you smoke one yourself, we can tell you it’s drafted from a premium blend of long-filler tobaccos from ecuador and nicaragua finished in a unique cuban-seed maduro wrapper grown in connecticut. its dark flavor profile is sweet and zesty. tasting notes of molasses, black cherries, peppers, and hickory commandeer the senses with ample spices in a handful of compact box-pressed shapes that unleash a plethora of hearty and smoky aromas. a medium-bodied, meaty finish completes the package. e.p. carrillo pledge is handcrafted in the dominican republic at perez-carrillo’s factory, tabacalera la alianza.

savor a 91-rated, mild to medium-bodied gem from e.p. carrillo with new wave connecticut. an approachable ecuador connecticut wrapper is drafted over a handcrafted variety of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos in a handful of popular shapes. the golden-blond wrapper leaf glistens in a sweet and creamy profile highlighted by toasty notes of leather, cedar and a touch of pepper with an enticing aroma. enjoy an easy-going cigar from legendary cigar-maker ernesto perez-carrillo for a great value today.

master cigar-maker and originator of la gloria cuban cigars, ernest perez-carrillo, earned a 95-point rating and the ‘#2 cigar of the year’ from cigar aficionado in 2014 with e.p. carrillo la historia. a luscious wrapper leaf from san andrés embraces a complex core of handcrafted tobaccos from ecuador, the dominican republic and nicaragua. woody, rich and sweet, la historia delivers a medium to full-bodied finish sure to resonate with boutique fanatics who can’t wait to try one of ernesto’s most praised cigars to date.

the man behind the original la gloria cubana franchise, ernesto perez carrillo, debuted his eponymous e.p. carrillo brand years ago and has since built up an audience of boutique enthusiasts who love to get a great deal on handmade premiums. e.p. carrillo inch maduro presents ernesto’s uber-popular inch brand with a sweet and succulent connecticut broadleaf maduro wrapper over a complex recipe of long-filler tobaccos from the dominican republic, nicaragua, and ecuador. inch is cleverly crafted for big ring gauge connoisseurs in a series of 60 and 60+ ring smokes that burn cool and slowly and deliver a medium to full-bodied profile of dark cocoa and chestnuts with sweet, earthy spices.

legendary cigar-maker and the man behind the original la gloria cubana brand, ernesto perez-carrillo, debuted e.p. carrillo inch back in 2012 to satisfy the burgeoning market for big ring gauge smokes. handmade in the dominican republic, e.p. carrillo inch became a quick hit with its bulbous, cool-burning profile of leather, earth, fresh ground coffee and creamy spices. an oily ecuador sumatra wrapper enshrouds an all-nicaraguan core of binder and filler tobaccos handcrafted to deliver a medium to full-bodied finish. fans of uber-thick, 60 and 60-plus ring gauge smokes should add e.p. carrillo inch to their regular rotation, save big, and get reacquainted with talents of blending maverick ernesto perez-carrillo today.

as the originator of the famed la gloria cubana brand, ernesto perez-carrillo successfully returns to the stage as a master cigar maker with his eponymous e.p. carrillo line. the small-batch, boutique brand includes cigar aficionado’s 96-rated ‘#1 cigar of the year’ for 2018, e.p. carrillo encore. the medium to full-bodied profile of all-nicaraguan tobaccos includes a lustrous reddish-brown wrapper leaf and is handcrafted in the dominican republic. woody, sweet, and zesty, e.p. carrillo encore delivers a touch of citrus and dried fruit with notes of caramel and cedar on the finish.

e.p. carrillo dusk joined the pantheon of recent top-rated e.p. carrillo smokes with a 92-point score and a ‘top 25’ ranking in cigar aficionado in 2017. a dark connecticut broadleaf wrapper houses a medium to full-bodied interior of binder and filler tobaccos from nicaragua. notes of sweet and salted almonds, raisins, graham cracker, and spices emerge in a handful of traditional shapes handmade in the dominican republic.

it’s tough to believe don tomas has been around for five decades. and did you know don tomas scored 90 points plus a ‘top 25’ ranking from cigar aficionado in 2006? look it up, son. it’s all true. add an under-the-radar, underestimated old-time brand to your daily rotation with don tomas clasico. the medium to full-bodied blend is drafted from an oily honduran wrapper leaf and a toasty selection of nicaraguan and honduran long-fillers in a handful of traditional shapes. notes of earth, wood, cocoa, nuts, and peppers magnetize the senses before a captivating finale lingers on the palate for just the right amount of time.

indulge in a well-rounded, medium-bodied profile from celebrated cigar-maker jose ‘pepin’ garcia with vegas cubanas. vibrant flavors of espresso, cedar and earth intermingle in creamy, balanced draws in an all-nicaraguan blend patiently handcrafted in estelí, nicaragua at the renowned my father factory. add an impressive pepin-made cigar to your collection for a magnificent value guaranteed to elate the senses with rich taste and an intriguing room note.

don pepin garcia serie jj is blended by legendary cigar-maker jose ‘pepin’ garcia. a lustrous corojo rosado wrapper leaf envelops a luscious and spicy blend of nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos grown on garcia family estates. the cigar is handmade at the award-winning my father factory in estelí, nicaragua. a handful of excellent formats reveals a medium to full-bodied profile with notes of cedar, coffee beans, baking spices, and leather. indulge in don pepin garcia serie jj for a bold but balanced bouquet of cubanesque flavor and aroma from one of the most respected cigar-makers in the business.

celebrated father-and-son cigar-makers pepin and jaime garcia established their renowned my father brand with popular early releases like don pepin garcia original, also called blue label for its navy cigar band. a glistening reddish-brown corojo oscuro wrapper leaf embraces a bountiful core of well-aged nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos. a collection of top-selling shapes is handmade with superior consistency and flavor in in the garcia family’s factory in miami. tasting notes of cayenne, cocoa, cedar, earth, and red peppers accompany signature garcia family spices in a full-bodied profile that beams with complexity and balance.

don pepin garcia cuban classic is a wonderful cigar crafted in estelí, nicaragua under the expert supervision of master cigar-maker jose ‘pepin’ garcia for whom the cigar is named. a full-bodied, earthy blend of premium nicaraguan long-fillers is drafted beneath an oily habano rosado wrapper leaf. notes of chestnuts, almonds, spices, and cocoa deliver a magnificent zest in a handful of traditional shapes. woody and spicy textures layer the palate with a touch of creaminess from beginning to end.

if you’re looking to smoke a big, long cigar of the finest quality and you like to smoke for a long period of time, but don’t necessarily want to spend a week’s salary on a box of boomsticks, then don lino trojan horse was designed just for you! delectable, gingerbread-hued ecuador habano wrappers boast tremendous flavors over a deep pairing of dominican long-filler tobaccos in the ginormous 7 x 60 gladiator format. when it comes to perfect aroma and satisfying flavor, abundance is an understatement. delicious notes of cedar, cocoa, coffee and oak deliver a creamy profile with just the right amount of spice. you may have to bolt two coolerdors together to house these bad boys, but the quality of the cigars and the money you’re saving are well worth the time!

don lino millennium preemptively commemorates an early victory in the market with one-thousand years of sales. although that statistic may one day be up for debate, what is certain is that millennium delivers superbly balanced notes of cedar, leather and spices with approachable, creamy flavors throughout a resounding medium-bodied finish. handcrafted in the dominican republic, sungrown cuban-seed wrappers envelop a rich blend of dominican long-fillers with a perfect burn. with up to 80% off msrp on the table, millennium can be the perfect after dinner treat for eons if you’re a value vulture looking to stack your coolerdor deep with the utmost in quality boomsticks.

when it comes to marrying reputation and brand name with cheap cigar prices, don lino fumas break down barriers no one thought possible. even the most curmudgeonly connoisseur can crack a smile when they see the miniscule total pop up when don lino’s in the shopping cart. a medium-bodied profile of wood, nougat, cedar and earth is tucked under a rich sumatra wrapper with an elegant sandwich-style mix of nicaraguan tobaccos. for those with a more sophisticated palate and a larger chore allowance, pick up several bundles of fumas and pass them out to your cigar-mooching pals who deplete your humidor they way mosquitoes drain a wildebeest on the serengeti.

don lino ruled the roost for flavor and quality during the cigar boom era of the 1990s. today, don lino is celebrated for great taste and ultra-low prices the most frugal aficionados we know absolutely swear by. originally slated to sell in the $12-15 priced bracket, don lino dark horse stands out as a top-shelf blend neatly packaged in glistening 20-count bundles we procured for pennies on the dollar in five classic shapes. don lino dark horse is drafted from an oily, gingerbread-hued ecuador habano wrapper leaf over a rich selection of vintage dominican and nicaraguan long-fillers. a medium-bodied profile of cedar, earth, spice, and ripened figs boasts a toasty, enticing aroma for discounts that are borderline criminal. join legions of thrifty don lino devotees who devour dark horse bundles by the dozen, son!

don lino casa verde is a refreshing change of pace if you're looking for a mild yet flavorful cigar. once a cigar shop staple years ago, candela wrappers have made a resurgence recently thanks to devotees who crave their particular taste, aroma and appearance. don lino casa verde boasts a luscious olive-green wrapper over a mild, all-dominican assemblage of binder and filler tobaccos for maximum satisfaction. crisp notes of freshly steeped green tea, hay, buttered toast and fennel arrive in every puff. reward your palate and satisfy your curiosity for candelas with don lino casa verde!

don diego gained a loyal following back during the cigar boom days of the 1990s. today, don diego’s value and flavor combine for unbeatably low prices thrifty deal-seekers and connoisseurs of easygoing cigars can’t resist. the creamy, old-school blend sports an updated cigar band, but stays true to its roots with an approachable nutty taste and notes of blonde roast coffee, cedar, and a hint of toasted spices. a silky connecticut shade wrapper embraces a tantalizing core of dominican and brazilian binder and filler tobaccos handcrafted in the dominican republic. add a delicious, mild to medium-bodied smoke to your daily rotation while big everyday discounts apply to don diego.

if you’re in search of an exclusive, special occasion premium cigar, don carlos edición de aniversario is in an elite tier. blended by renowned cigar-maker carlito fuente to commemorate the 30th anniversary of the don carlos line, a cornerstone in the fuente portfolio, this premium, ultra-rare cigar is handcrafted from the finest aged tobaccos available. a glistening shade grown dominican wrapper, cultivated on the legendary chateau de la fuente estates and normally reserved for fuente fuente opus x cigars, embraces patiently aged dominican binder and filler components. a medium-bodied profile of almond, caramel, leather, and coffee bean tasting notes embellishes the palate with signature dominican spices from beginning to end. choose from a handful of classic sizes, and savor an ultra-limited gem from the legendary fuente portfolio without hesitation when we have them in stock.

diesel unlimited boasts bold flavors and full-bodied complexity perfect for cigar nuts looking to ply their regular rotation with a bit of power. oily honduran wrappers cover a rich combo of long-filler tobaccos from nicaragua brimming with woody flavors of chocolate, leather and earth. each draw offers a copious amount of smoke that is certain to get your attention with a smooth and toasty, full-flavored finish. the possibilities for satisfaction are limitless with diesel unlimited.

pennsylvania broadleaf wrappers aren’t the most commonplace, but they happen to be quite delicious and diesel is a perfect opportunity to sink your senses into the medium to full-bodied combination of sweet spices and earthiness they present. diesel offers an added touch of strength courtesy of a fortified pairing of nicaraguan long-fillers on the inside. satisfy all the longings you have for intensity with diesel’s superb construction and powerful finish. add some density to the selection in your humidor with diesel today.

diamond crown julius caeser honors the founder of the j.c. newman cigar company. this honorary cigar is meticulously crafted and superbly blended in small batch fashion by the fuentes in the dominican republic. a flavorful ecuador habano wrapper encapsulates a carefully aged, smooth and robust blend of filler tobaccos hailing from the dominican republic and nicaragua that yield a medium to full-bodied smoking experience highlighted by prominent notes of coffee, fresh-cut cedar and a savory spice.

diamond crown black diamond is blended from a handful of proprietary tobaccos grown by the fuente family on their world-renowned chateau de la fuente estates in the dominican republic. a succulently aged connecticut broadleaf wrapper marries the rich and flavorful profile of select dominican binder and filler tobaccos. leathery notes of dark chocolate and morning dew reveal a chewy spice with hints of hazelnut and cedar. indulge in a top-shelf rarity from diamond crown blended by legendary father-and-son cigar-makers carlito fuente and carlos fuente sr. to an impeccable standard.

diamond crown in manufactured by tabacalera a. fuente for j.c. newman. these cigars exhibit a medium-bodied demeanor and a wonderfully-rich flavor-profile. a regal blend of aged dominican tobaccos is cocooned inside a beautiful blonde connecticut shade-grown wrapper. the flavors are rich and creamy boasting enticing notes of coffee, nuts and leather.

handmade by the fellas at drew estate, deadwood delivers a collection of sweet and aromatic cigars crafted from long-filler tobaccos cured very much like pipe tobacco. exotic and succulent notes of dark chocolate, cherries, and maple syrup reveal a chewy, woody perfume of sweet, smoky, and spicy aromas. the cigar’s cap is coated with sugar to give it a tangible contrast with its earthy and spicy character. the blend is more akin to drew estate’s natural line than to the company’s well-known infused acid collection. if you enjoy flavored cigars, or pipe tobacco, in particular, deadwood is a brand you should add to your rotation. choose from a handful unique shapes with wacky names when you’re in search of a sweet or adventuresome new cigar.

davidoff yamasa is named for the yamasa region in the dominican republic, where select tobaccos are grown and harvested for the medium-bodied blend. a balanced combination of dominican and nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos rests beneath a dominican wrapper to deliver flavors of coffee, cedar, pepper and peat. experience the new dimensions yamasa adds to the davidoff portfolio with intriguing aromas and a tasteful profile.
