add a handcrafted, medium to full-bodied profile to your top-shelf rotation with davidoff winston churchill late hour. an ecuador habano wrapper leaf is drafted over a combination of san andrés binder tobaccos and filler leaves from the dominican republic and nicaragua. select tobaccos are aged for 6 months in single malt scotch casks to impart distinct whiskey-laden notes of coffee, pepper and wood. the dark-chocolate-hued blend celebrates the late hours at which winston churchill often discovered the inspiration to accomplish his life’s many endeavors.

davidoff’s winston churchill line was blended to commemorate the world’s original cigar-smoking statesman and has undergone a recent overhaul. a new, sophisticated blend of core components includes tobaccos from the dominican republic, nicaragua and mexico beneath a savory ecuador wrapper. peppery nuances sit alongside notes of leather, dark coffee and cedar. an iconic silhouette of sir winston churchill elegantly adorns the band on each cigar. taste this stately cigar today!

davidoff signature is the epitome of the classic davidoff cigar. handmade using a buttery ecuador connecticut wrapper and a mellow blend of dominican tobaccos, these cigars possess a mild demeanor along with a gentle medley of smooth flavors. in true davidoff fashion, the lion’s share of the sizes boast thin ring-gauges which is another nod to davidoff’s european roots.

rolled in the dominican republic, davidoff nicaragua box press is a full-bodied all-nicaraguan blend featuring an oily, oscuro wrapper. wild notes of spice arrive in a nutty, intense profile with bitter-sweet flavors. the box press line adds an enhanced peppery component to the original davidoff nicaragua blend. a cool draw and balanced combination of nicaraguan long-fillers offer an approachable finish that is bolder than usual from davidoff.

davidoff nicaragua was blended for cigar aficionados who desire a robust, elegant cigar with a bit more strength and zest than what's currently available in davidoff's vast portfolio of cigars. it's medium-bodied and a bit peppery thanks to the glistening 10-year-old cuban-seed nicaraguan wrapper and spicy, rich and refined filler tobaccos hailing from nicaragua.

typically, davidoff cigars reside in the mild-medium end of the strength spectrum. davidoff millennium blend breaks this mold on every surface. medium-bodied in strength, these cigars are laced with an intoxicating, earthy richness enhanced by notes of oak, leather and nutmeg. the finish is mostly creamy with a crispy spiciness to boot.

davidoff grand cru is a top-shelf cigar manufactured in the dominican republic. comprised of a rich blend of aged dominican tobaccos and a silky ecuador connecticut wrapper, davidoff grand cru offers a pleasurable smoking experience that’s rich in flavor yet smooth in delivery. sweet and creamy notes combine seamlessly with an earthy flavor-core which segues into a long, smooth finish.

davidoff gift packs collect all your favorite davidoff cigars in elegant, high-gloss boxes fitting select cigar quantities and are perfect for giving your favorite cigar lover on any special occasion. davidoff gift packs are great for showing appreciation or celebrating a cigar enthusiast’s love of fine cigars. choose from a number of davidoff’s most popular blends and order your davidoff gift packs today!

davidoff is a top-shelf cigar maker well-known for producing a large portfolio of primarily milder blends from the dominican republic. however, over the past few years the company has branched out into other regions with its black-banded cigar lines. davidoff escurio extends the brand in another new direction with a rich, medium to full-bodied blend of brazilian binders paired with brazilian and dominican fillers under a robust, sultry ecuador habano wrapper. escurio presents a balanced combination of sweet and spicy notes with hints of leather, nuts and cinnamon. exquisite construction with a cool, slow-burning complexity offers a memorable, satisfying finish. escurio is handcrafted in the dominican republic, however, the line’s motif is intended to celebrate the vitality and sparkle of brazil. spice up the selection in your humidor with davidoff escurio. order yours today!

davidoff cigarillos are perfect for a quick break. each cigarillo is crafted from a cinnamon-hued sumatra wrapper and a smooth blend of brazilian, indonesian and java tobaccos. flavors of cream, coffee and pepper reveal a mild, approachable profile that can be enjoyed with a moment’s notice. for a slightly milder body than davidoff gold, chose the davidoff silver brand. take a hiatus from a busy day with classic davidoff tasting notes in popular and efficient, small-format cigarillos.

davidoff aniversario series is davidoff’s top-of-the-line cigar. a beautifully rich blend of aged dominican tobaccos rests inside the embrace of a luxuriously smooth ecuador connecticut wrapper. these beauties provide a smooth, cedary flavor-core laced with nuances of nuts, cream and coffee bean. the finish is the superbly smooth and satisfying.

legendary cigar-maker carlito fuente counts cuesta rey centro fino as one of the many tasteful cigars he’s blended over the years. a dark and oily ecuador sumatra wrapper leaf provides a magnificent finish to a myriad of dominican long-fillers that glisten with complexity. notes of cedar, earth, leather, and black pepper arrive in a handful of classic shapes that deliver a consistently pristine burn with an excellent draw.

handmade in the dominican republic by tabacalera a. fuente, cuesta rey is a mild to medium-bodied cigar that features either a connecticut shade or connecticut broadleaf maduro wrapper. the aged blend of dominican tobaccos creates a nice creamy base for the wrappers to build upon. the connecticut shade wrapper adds a subtle, spicy sweetness with faint hints of nuts and leather, while the maduro wrapper adds richer notes of cocoa and espresso. coming from the fuentes, you know these cigars are well-made and worth every penny.

cuba aliados vintage cigars are drafted from old family recipes from the cookbook of legendary cigar-maker rolando reyes sr., aka roly. although roly passed away in 2012, his blends live on under the stewardship of his grandson, carlos diez, who ensures cuba aliados cigars are handcrafted to the same standards for quality and taste established by his grandfather. roly began making cigars at the age of nine in cuba and departed the island nation in 1975 at the age of fifty-one. he went on to create the cuba aliados and puros indios brands in honduras and was well known for his attention to detail. a lifetime of knowledge of blending, aging, and producing premium cigars is reflected in cuba aliados vintage. an oily honduran maduro wrapper leaf embraces an intricate core of dominican and nicaraguan long-fillers handmade in a series of popular sizes. a medium-bodied profile of malted chocolate, smoked meat, leather, and pepper precedes a bold but nicely balanced finish. add budget-friendly boxes of cuba aliados to your coolerdor from one of the most dedicated and passionate cigar-makers of his day.

cromagnon cigars are brought to us by roma craft tobac. handmade in estelí, nicaragua, cromagnon is a small production brand that features a medium to full-bodied profile of earthy spices with a slightly sweet backbone. a hearty connecticut broadleaf wrapper conceals a flavorful pairing of core tobaccos with a cameroon binder and nicaraguan long-fillers. adorned with the logo of a human skull, cromagnon proudly touts the tagline 'rustic, primal, strong.'

cromaganon aquitaine is a small production brand manufactured in estelí, nicaragua by roma craft tobac. aquitaine is constructed using ecuador habano wrappers and a combination of cameroon binders along with nicaraguan long-fillers. tempered spices with a bit of caramel and hints of nuts provide a satisfying finish. cromagnon cigars feature skull head packaging and eventful aromas.

make a phenomenal addition to your humidor with cortesia. an elegant medium-bodied profile of patiently aged long-filler tobaccos is handcrafted in the dominican republic. buttery notes of dark chocolate, coffee and cedar meld with approachable, creamy spices in a perfect draw. choose this classic churchill format and enjoy a luscious blend that agrees with almost any occasion.

catching up with the nicaraguan craze of the past ten years, general cigar company, the parent company of a number of cuban-heritage brands including cohiba, punch, partagas, and more, released cohiba nicaragua. the blend features a complex recipe of long-fillers cultivated from the rich, volcanic soils of nicaragua’s key growing regions, while a nicaraguan oscuro wrapper leaf finishes the equation with sweet and earthy nuances. spicy notes of white pepper and dried fruit earned an initial 91-point rating following the cigar’s debut.

cohiba blue breathes a fresh perspective and look into a legendary cuban-heritage brand. the medium-bodied profile is patiently handcrafted in the dominican republic in a handful of classic formats. an approachable, everyday blend emerges from a gingerbread-hued honduran wrapper over a tasteful pairing of dominican, nicaraguan and honduran long-filler tobaccos. notes of cocoa, brown sugar and cinnamon furnish touches of spice in an elegant conclusion. cohiba blue is available at slightly more affordable price points than many other blends in the brand’s illustrious portfolio. taste a legend with a new look today.

cohiba black is drafted from a jet-black connecticut broadleaf maduro wrapper and an intricate recipe of dominican and mexican tobaccos. medium-bodied notes of cocoa, espresso beans, and hickory include a leathery texture and a sweet, lingering finish. cohiba black was blended to present optimal flavor from the famous cuban-legacy brand in a maduro wrapper varietal that resonates in both taste and room note. handcrafted for the burgeoning portfolio of general cigar company, cohiba smokes tend to carry a spendy price tag, but should not go overlooked if you’re still waiting to sample this iconic cuban-heritage brand.

as one of the best-known cuban-legacy brands in the world, cohiba casts a wide net of cigar lovers who’ve given it a try. back in cuba, the brand was originally conceived as personal blend for dictator fidel castro and was not widely distributed to consumers for many years. today, the premium cigar market in the u.s. enjoys access to a cohiba that’s handcrafted in the dominican republic, while the cuban version enjoys a burgeoning audience in a host of other nations. the dominican cohiba is handmade for the portfolio of tobacco conglomerate general cigar company alongside other iconic brands, including macanudo, la gloria cubana, punch, and many more. cohiba is drafted from a delicate reddish-hued cameroon wrapper leaf and an interior of dominican and indonesian tobaccos. medium-bodied notes of peppers, wood, and leather culminate with a bit of sweetness in an approachable finish.

charter oak connecticut from foundation cigar company is blended from a golden-blond ecuador connecticut wrapper leaf over a complex recipe of nicaraguan long-fillers from estelí and jalapa. brand founder nick melillo named charter oak for a historic tree, which stood from the 12th century until the 1850s, where native americans would gather in what today is hartford, connecticut. tasting notes of cedar, balsa wood, cashew, and vanilla bean mingle with hints of alfalfa and pepper in a chewy value-priced smoke you can add to your regular rotation without breaking the bank. the critics in cigar aficionado rated charter oak connecticut 93 points back in 2018.

charter oak broadleaf from foundation cigar company is a value-based brand blended by nick melillo and handmade in estelí, nicaragua. one of melillo’s favorite tobaccos to blend with is connecticut broadleaf because it’s harvested in his home state. under the wrapper is a hearty blend of cuban-seed nicaraguan long-fillers. sweet notes of dark chocolate, earth, and hazelnut weave an intriguing tapestry over the palate before hints of coffee and citrus enter the equation. charter oak broadleaf is peppery and pleasant but won’t exhaust your monthly cigar budget when you’re in search of a small-batch brand to add to the coolerdor.

castano is handcrafted in the dominican republic in a handful of classic shapes that deliver quintessential dominican tasting notes. a cinnamon-hued sun grown wrapper leaf embraces a stellar core of long-fillers to deliver a complex profile of nutmeg, cayenne, and toasted spices. you can count on superb aroma and an easy burn for a price that hardly makes a dent in your monthly cigar allowance.

there’s no need to scour the blowout bin in your local smokeshop when you can score handcrafted 20-count bundles from casa turrent at rock-bottom prices direct from your pals at holt’s. a seamless sumatra wrapper leaf embraces a beefy blend of premium long-fillers from san andrés in a series of well-made shapes. a medium-bodied profile of leather, nuts, baking spices, and wood layers the palate before a rich and smoky finish develops. the turrent family is best-known for growing premium tobaccos for many of today’s biggest cigar-makers. taste a signature cigar from casa turrent today fill the coolerdor to maximum capacity for lowest prices in america!

casa royale cigars are handcrafted in the dominican republic in a collection of well-made, affordable formats. creamy notes of almonds, coffee beans, and baking spices layer the palate before luscious finish. the blend is handmade from a premium amalgam of dominican and nicaraguan long-fillers tucked under a seamless connecticut shade wrapper leaf. add a box of casa royale to your collection for a perfect everyday blend with consistent taste and flawless construction at an unbeatable price.

cao pilon pleases the palate with a profile of roasted coffee beans, wood, peppers, and almonds. premium binder and filler tobaccos from nicaragua and san andrés are blanketed by an oily cuban-seed wrapper leaf grown in ecuador. cao pilon is medium-bodied and received a 90-point rating following its debut. the blend has added to the brand’s evolving portfolio of distinct and complex cigars with variety of well-made classic shapes.

in cao’s well-known world series – a line that calls tribute to specific tobacco-growing nations – cao nicaragua arrives with a full-flavored recipe of binder and filler tobaccos from nicaragua, san andres, and honduras beneath a reddish-brown honduran wrapper leaf. chestnuts, earth, baking spices, and leather deliver a toasty finish in a handful of classic shapes. the 91-rated cigar pays homage to nicaragua by drawing on the nation’s three key growing regions: jalapa, estelí, and condega.

cao mx2 is an interesting cigar which features a maduro wrapper and a maduro binder. an oily, charcoal-black connecticut broadleaf wrapper drapes a brazilian binder which cradles an eclectic blend of dominican, honduran, nicaraguan and peruvian filler tobaccos. medium to full-bodied, these cigars are richly-flavored boasting notes of earth, oak, pepper and a soft chocolaty sweetness on the finish.

cao maduro is a classically-blended beauty. handmade in nicaragua, these cigars feature dark connecticut broadleaf wrappers along with an eventful medley of dominican and nicaraguan tobaccos. medium to full-bodied in strength, cao maduro offers a well-balanced, earthy foundation supported by a rich, mouthwatering sweetness provided by the maduro wrapper.

cao began a globe-trotting odyssey years ago with the release of numerous cigars that celebrate the tobaccos of distinctive regions, even nations less-commonly known for tobacco production like italy. cao italia presents a 4-country blend handcrafted from nicaraguan, peruvian, and italian long-fillers beneath a dark and succulent honduran wrapper leaf. full-flavored notes of cedar, espresso beans, and peppery spices deliver a sweet and lingering finish in a handful of shapes named for iconic italian staples.

add the 90-rated cao gold to your collection when you’re looking for a creamy and approachable medium-bodied blend. an ecuador connecticut wrapper leaf hugs a mellow amalgam of all-nicaraguan long-fillers. notes of cedar, cashews, and toast emerge with hints of cocoa and leather. choose from a handful of classic sizes handcrafted for a big name brand that sits beside macanudo and cohiba in the portfolio of general cigar company. cao gold is a blend that originally helped to put the brand on the map back in the day.

cao sets the modern-day standard for top-quality flavored cigars. their flavored concoctions run the gamut from cherry and vanilla to mango and mint ice cream. manufactured in the dominican republic, cao flavours sport a mellow assortment of long-filler tobaccos doused in just about every flavor the mind can imagine. these cigars are a must-try for flavored cigar lovers.

cao has a reputation for packaging cigars inside of attention-grabbing boxes, instantly recognizable to the cigar-smoking public, and cao flathead is no exception for fans of muscle cars and pin-up girls. rev up your engines and put the pedal to the metal in preparation for a succulent blast of flavor courtesy of a broadleaf wrapper over a mix of nicaraguan, dominican and connecticut binder and filler tobaccos. cao flathead took home a 95-point rating from cigar aficionado with the ‘#3 cigar of the year’ title in 2015. notes of walnuts, vanilla and sweet cocoa leave savory impressions before the finish line. each box-pressed size delivers a perfect smoke for tooling around in the garage, or taking a cruise around town. vroom!

cao colombia continues its series of internationally themed blends with a complex medium-bodied recipe. a leathery nicaraguan wrapper leaf covers a unique amalgam of cameroon binder tobaccos and fillers from brazil and colombia. notes of oak, vanilla, nougat, and dark fruit accompany a nutty finish. add a 92-rated gem handcrafted in nicaragua in a series of popular shapes. cao colombia is guaranteed to stand out in your cigar collection thanks to the brand’s vivid boxes and bands.

cao cameroon is a classically blended cigar that showcases a beautiful, delicate cameroon wrapper. beneath this wrapper, you’ll find a rich blend of nicaraguan tobaccos that yields a smooth, sweet aroma with the faintest hint of spicy goodness. handmade in nicaragua, cao cameroon delivers a medium-bodied finish with nutty notes of coffee, wood, and cocoa in a handful of classic shapes. cao cameroon scored 92 points back in the day.

handcrafted in honduras, cao brazilia is an incredibly dark cigar that offers rich, earthy flavors and a substantial amount of spice. comprised of a long-filler blend of nicaraguan tobaccos ensconced in a beautiful brazilian wrapper, these cigars tip the scales at the upper end of the medium-bodied spectrum. amidst the earthy and peppery profile, nuances of licorice and leather can be found along with a subtle sweetness. cao brazilia scored a 91-point rating back in the day thanks to its long toasty finish.

cao arcana firewalker cigars are created according to an old-world tobacco fermentation method called chincagre. firewalker is blended from nicaraguan long-fillers that have been fermented in pilónes, or large tobacco piles, buried deep in the volcanic soil of nicaragua’s masatepe region. sweet and aromatic flavors naturally emerge during the subterranean maturation process. a traditional, secondary fermentation occurs at the factory for nine additional months when the chincagre process is complete. cao arcana firewalker is finished in a cuban-seed rosado wrapper grown in ecuador. savory and complex notes of hickory, mesquite, leather, and pepper envelop the palate before a sweet finish resonates. taste cao’s revival of archaic cigar-making techniques in the latest edition to the arcana series in a chunky toro.

years ago, cao introduced its world collection, a series of blends inspired by specific regions around the globe. cao america boasts the tried and true red, white, and blue on the boxes and bands and a complex four-country amalgam of dominican, nicaraguan, italian, and american tobaccos. the wrapper is drafted from a barberpole-style connecticut broadleaf with a connecticut shade pinstripe. rich, leathery notes of chocolate and cedar earned the blend a 92-point rating from cigar aficionado back when it debuted.

powdery puffs with notes of coffee and wood course throughout the dark, oily san andrés wrapper of camacho triple maduro cigars. an all-maduro interior of long-fillers from brazil, honduras, and the dominican republic accompany the brand’s original corojo tobaccos. complex, multinational characteristics furnish notes of dried fruit and leather through a firm draw. triple maduro boasts a full-bodied conclusion many cigar lovers can’t put down. secure a box for yourself today!

camacho scorpion sun grown cigars deliver a bold profile of peppery and sweet flavor with a big, boisterous finish. an oily ecuador habano wrapper leaf hugs a beefy blend of nicaraguan and honduran long-fillers in a collection that includes a classic robusto, plus a pair of ultra-fat 60 and 70 ring gauge behemoths. camacho scorpion sun grown is handcrafted in honduras to the stringent protocols of camacho’s parent company, davidoff. camacho scorpion sun grown is your chance to score chunky, honduran handmade gems for your coolerdor at a stinging discount.

camacho scorpion connecticut cigars are drawn from a golden ecuador connecticut wrapper leaf over a chunky amalgam of premium nicaraguan and honduran long-fillers. luscious notes of nuts and blonde roast coffee mingle with hints of white pepper and almond with a consistent spice from beginning to end. camacho cigars are handcrafted in honduras to the exacting standards of camacho’s parent company, davidoff. choose from a pair of big ring gauge shapes, or a classic robusto, for a mild to medium-bodied smoke you can add to your coolerdor at an epic discount.

camacho nicaragua cigars are handcrafted in honduras by davidoff from a complex blend of dominican, honduran, and nicaraguan tobaccos beneath an ecuador wrapper leaf. tasting notes of espresso, black pepper, leather, and hay command the palate with burly flavor and aroma. although the blend is not technically made in nicaragua as the name implies, the nicaraguan long-fillers selected for the blend influence the cigar’s profile with a savory character before a hearty, medium to full-bodied finish sets in. serve up meaty, scorpion-festooned cigars handmade to davidoff’s impeccable standards for quality the next time you’re hosting poker night in your man cave. camacho nicaragua rises to the occasion without exhausting your monthly cigar budget.

camacho manufactures some of the world’s strongest, spiciest cigars. at the top of that list is camacho corojo. handmade in honduras, camacho corojo is crafted from an all-honduran recipe stuffed to the brim with rich and spicy ligero tobaccos. a potent profile of earth, cayenne, and black pepper segues into a long, leathery finish.

camacho connecticut is the mildest cigar in camacho’s stable. an ecuador connecticut wrapper leaf blankets a mellow blend of honduran and dominican long-filler tobaccos. handcrafted in honduras, camacho connecticut delivers flavors of cedar, almonds, and earth with a hint of peppery spices that lead to a medium-bodied finish.

as the top cain account in the entire country, we know cain ain’t for the faint of heart. the number of rough-and-tumble tough guys who smoke cain never ceases to amaze us. we’re talking about the types of guys who drive tanks and wear helmets to work. that’s why we’ve added cain tubes to the cain aisle in our warehouse. take advantage of all your favorite ligero-laden cain smokes in a sturdy and convenient tube you can easily stuff in the front pocket of your carhartt when you’re heading out to fire up the chainsaw. choose cain f, cain habano, and cain maduro options in a rugged and colorful tube when you’re craving the beefy, woody flavors only the bestselling spice-bombs in the industry deliver.

cain nub might not be the largest cigar you’ve ever smoked, but boy does it pack a wallop! rolled using cain’s blistering blend of 100% ligero tobaccos, cain nub is supremely full-bodied and loaded with enough peppery spice to make a cajun blush. a leathery flavor followed by a slightly-sweet, cedary finish can be found lurking in the mace-like clouds of smoke produced by this pint-sized powerhouse.

taste the full-flavored, full-bodied profile of legendary cain smokes with a touch of added sweetness in cain maduro. a feisty recipe of premium nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos is bound by a toothy and succulent maduro wrapper leaf. cain is primarily made from spicy ligero long-fillers. notes of dark chocolate, espresso beans, hickory, and black pepper carries plenty of cain’s signature zest. cain maduro is handmade to a flawless standard in a handful of ultra-popular shapes at the legendary oliva factory in estelí, nicaragua. add cain maduro to your collection when you want a beefy, after-dinner smoke to follow your steak or a need something a little more intense while you’re running the chainsaw. cain ain’t for the faint of heart. cain is for tough guys only!

cain habano is handmade from a full-bodied recipe of all-nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos tucked under a chewy cuban-seed wrapper leaf. notes of red and black peppers, wood, earth, and leather pluck at the senses with perfect balance and complexity. cain habano is handcrafted at the legendary oliva factory in estelí, nicaragua by a team of seasoned cigar-makers. cain is the official brand of lumberjacks and big rig truckers thanks to the potent and peppery, ligero-laden taste and aroma the brand delivers. crank up the flavor with cain!

the cain brand is handmade at the award-winning oliva factory in estelí, nicaragua. cain f is drafted from a potent and peppery ligero-laden recipe of premium nicaraguan long-fillers beneath a shimmering cuban-seed wrapper leaf. notes of cayenne, black peppery, hickory, and leather populate the full-bodied profile of cain f. fans of stronger smokes love the robust taste and aroma cain f delivers. add cain f to the coolerdor when you need cigars with a beefy, peppery zest and plenty of complexity. choose from a handful of classic shapes blended to a consistent, flawless standard.

cain daytona is a more refined version of its ligero-laced brethren, cain. this medium-bodied version is accomplished with the utilization of an all-jalapa filler blend delivering a balanced level of smoothness and flavor without the intense body and strength of the regular cain. construction is spot-on and is headlined by an oily nicaraguan wrapper that is not only visually appealing, but also highly complex with notes ranging from green pepper to a creamy, honey-like sweetness.

cain is handcrafted to a superb standard at the award-winning oliva factory in estelí, nicaragua. known for pumping out a predominantly potent portfolio of peppery, ligero-laden gems, cain connecticut ct takes the zest down just a touch with a silky, golden-blond ecuador connecticut wrapper over a medium-bodied recipe of all-nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos. a crisp and nutty profile of white pepper, cayenne, cashews, and cedar delivers plenty of kick for the typical cain fan looking for the perfect breakfast smoke. wash down your morning coffee and bacon with cain connecticut ct or serve it up as an appetizer to one of the brand’s spicier, more full-bodied entrées. remember, cain is for tough guys only, son!

cain black cigars are handcrafted at the prestigious oliva factory in estelí, nicaragua, where they’re blended from a potent array of premium nicaraguan long-fillers tucked under an oily cuban-seed nicaraguan wrapper. hefty notes of leather, toasted nuts, and black pepper mingle with hints of gingerbread and nutmeg in three popular sizes. cain black harbors just enough sweetness to tame the cigar’s overall intensity before a robust finish bathes the palate with woody spices. cain black is a prime specimen when you’re craving a powerful but smooth smoke blended and crafted to the award-winning standards of oliva for an unbeatable value.

brick house is an old-time cigar brand resurrected from the ashes by the j.c. newman cigar company. the cigar was named after the brick house the newman family lived in, circa 1895. modern-day brick house cigars are blended from an oily ecuador habano wrapper or a dark and toothy brazilian maduro, and inside of each blend is a hearty marriage of well-aged nicaraguan long-fillers. brick house cigars deliver meaty notes of mesquite, cedar, hickory, leather, and pepper for an unbeatable bargain. the critics awarded brick house with a 93-point rating a few years back and ranked it among the top value brands. add a box of brickhouse to your coolerdor today.

data.cigar_name: argyle it's a boy / it's a girl
data.cigar_description: having a child is a momentous occasion that most definitely calls for a celebration. thanks to argyle it’s a boy/it’s a girl cigars, you can hand out quality cigars to your heart’s content without having to cash in junior’s college fund. you see, argyle is widely considered to be the ‘#1 value cigar in america’ and for good reason. handmade in the dominican republic, argyle features silky blond connecticut wrappers and a smooth blend of all-dominican long-fillers. these cigars are so good that people will be eagerly awaiting your next offspring, and so affordable you’ll be able to share the good news with everyone in town!

fiercely popular value brand argyle delivers a magnificently mild, dominican-crafted profile at an exceptionally affordable price with argyle fumas connecticut. golden-blond connecticut shade wrappers embrace a balanced core of premium sandwich tobaccos from the dominican republic. elegant notes of toasted nuts, coffee with cream and a touch of white pepper offer a marvelous transition of flavor and a luscious finish. choose from a handful of traditional shapes for a superlative everyday blend in a 20-count bundle from argyle, 'the most trusted name in value cigars!'

the ‘#1 value cigar in america’ just got even better friends... argyle fumas are handcrafted in one of the world's premier boutique cigar factories. carefully blended with a rich selection of premium dominican sandwich tobaccos, these cigars are finished off using silky smooth sumatra wrappers. mild to medium-bodied, these value-priced cigars are mellow and smooth boasting light notes of cream, coffee and nuts.

argyle dark corojo offers a perfect portrait of flavor and value. handmade in the dominican republic in one of the world's leading boutique cigar factories, a beautifully oily corojo wrapper embraces a bold, yet balanced blend of aged dominican and nicaraguan tobaccos. the medium-bodied profile boasts rich flavors of earth with succulent notes of oak, leather, cream and black pepper that lead to a toasty finish. argyle dark corojo is available for the same mind-blowing bargain as the original argyle with magnificent flavors and perfect approachability, all for the price of a yard ‘gar, friends. get yours today!

‘the most trusted name in value cigars’ delivers a superb, handcrafted profile of dark chocolate, raisins and coffee beans with an approachable draw and an enticing flavor in argyle conundrum. a medium-bodied blend of dominican binder and filler tobaccos rests beneath a plum-like connecticut broadleaf wrapper with a tasteful and subtle sheen. get the size that best speaks to your palate and add a great value-priced cigar to your collection, perfect for after dinner or any time of day you feel like firing up.

hailing from one of the top boutique cigar factories in the dominican republic, argyle candela is an extra-smooth, mild smoke that carries earthy notes and a balanced sweetness with a slightly creamy texture. like all argyle cigars, the construction is spot on with an exceptional burn and an outstanding draw. as the most unique member of the argyle family, a.k.a. ''the #1 value cigar in america,'' the silky green wrapper never disappoints at a price that is just right!

the everyday bargain that argyle brings to the table just got bigger as the brand expands its reach into its most petite format to date with argyle bowtie. ‘the most trusted name in value cigars’ is packing its reliable profile of nuts, coffee and buttered toast into a dainty 4.125 x 32 size that can be enjoyed any time of day in almost any circumstance. never deprive yourself of pleasure for the perfect price just because you’re short on time. buy argyle bowtie and prepare for the ultimate satisfaction in a small format!

argyle banquet selection unveils top-shelf flavor, superb consistency and impressive balance. known as a premier value brand, argyle has substantially bumped up its prestige with banquet selection. a premium, golden wrapper leaf is patiently sown in the connecticut river valley and rolled over a stunning array of aged dominican and nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos. an elegant, mild to medium-bodied profile delivers blissful notes of toasted almonds, cocoa and coffee with a touch of black pepper. argyle banquet finishes with exquisite aromas destined to please the most discriminating palates. experience the most refined and sophisticated argyle to date in a variety of flawlessly constructed, classic formats.

argyle is all about quality and value. handmade in the dominican republic, these cigars are crafted using silky connecticut wrappers and a light, creamy blend of all-dominican long-fillers. excellent flavors and superb construction are the hallmark qualities of this bestselling brand. mild, mellow, nutty and smooth, these cigars are rich and elegant, boasting savory notes of cream, cashews and coffee beans. argyle cigars arrive packaged neatly in cedar chests of 20.

why gamble with your precious cigar allowance when you’re simply after an economically priced blend that burns straight and tastes great? deal a winning profile out to all the cigar-pilfering pals you’ve got who show up at your man cave empty handed on poker night with all in! a golden blond connecticut shade wrapper conceals a light, mild blend of dominican tobaccos you can handout without thinking twice for roughly a buck-a-stick. take your pick from three classic shapes handcrafted in the dominican republic.

alec bradley fans who place a premium on value have access to white gold, a mixed-filler blend crafted to keep your bottom dollar intact. an ecuador connecticut wrapper blankets a core of dominican and nicaraguan tobaccos blended to deliver satisfaction for a minimal investment. enjoy a profile of toasted nuts with a touch of cream in an everyday value by alec bradley. add an inexpensive box of nicaraguan boomsticks to the shopping cart without having to make a special trip to the dollar cigar store, son!

the alec bradley texas lancero is a paradox of sorts. the super-sized smoke is an overwhelming 7 inches long with a 70 ring gauge, as you might expect by the reference to texas in the name. the medium-bodied behemoth is drafted from a reddish-brown nicaraguan wrapper leaf and plump proportions of nicaraguan, honduran, indonesian, and costa rican long-fillers. notes of assorted nuts, leather, cayenne, earth, and wood pack approachable spices in a long, lingering finish.

as head of alec bradley, alan rubin has turned a corner from his highly rated, original tempus line which features a honduran wrapper. alec bradley tempus nicaragua showcases a premium nicaraguan wrapper over a solid combination of all-nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos. a rich, medium-bodied profile of pepper, cedar, leather and spices develops with a zesty finish. bold flavors and a consistent burn should easily put the tempus nicaragua on the radar of alec bradley fans and cigar lovers craving a nicaraguan puro.

tempus was patiently blended to put alec bradley on the map of cigar lovers everywhere. a dark brown honduaran wrapper encloses a robust blend of aged honduran and nicaraguan tobaccos for maximum satisfaction. the strength is medium to full-bodied with rich flavors of earth, spices and a slightly sweet finish. in addition to a 94-rating, tempus also earned a spot in cigar aficionado’s “top 25 cigars of the year” in 2008. experience one of alec bradley’s finest blends.

back in 2011, the fellas at alec bradley scored cigar aficionado’s coveted ‘#1 cigar of the year’ title with their 96-rated prensado release. the much-awaited alec bradley prensado lost art carries the tradition forward with a premium handcrafted blend. a caramel-hued honduran wrapper embraces a rich core of nicaraguan and honduran tobaccos that blossom with flavors of coffee beans, leather, cinnamon and cayenne that deliver a touch of sweetness around the edges. dig into chapter two of an award-winning saga of flavor and aroma from alec bradley.

alec bradley prensado shot to the top of the charts in its debut year by garnering an illustrious 96-point rating from cigar aficionado and officially anointing the fellas at alec bradley as the poster boys for the prestigious ‘#1 cigar of the year’ title. although prensado’s #1 award may gently be at rest up in the trophy case, the fervor has hardly worn off. that’s due in large part to magnificently consistent cigar-making of the highest caliber and killer discounts that recur on a daily basis. an oily honduran corojo wrapper leaf blankets an authentic mix of nicaraguan and honduran long-fillers. a sweet and spicy profile delivers hints of red peppers and cinnamon with a touch of molasses in a smooth, box-pressed physique. you don’t need a shovel to dig up ratings-gold at an affordable price when you’re on the alec bradley prensado page at holt’s!

as a former cigar aficionado ‘#1 cigar of the year’ titleholder, the alec bradley brand has been mesmerizing cigar lovers with a plethora of top-rated blends over the years. brand founder alan rubin continually churns out a popular portfolio of cigars you can score for a major discount from your pals holt’s, son! the 91-rated alec bradley nica puro rosado is no exception with a blissful all-nicaraguan recipe of long-filler tobaccos patiently handcrafted beneath a glistening rosado wrapper leaf. medium to full-bodied notes of chestnuts, cashews, leather and black pepper deliver an approachable, mouthwatering aftertaste with inspiring aromas. get the tangles out of your man-bun while you puff away on the bestselling alec bradley cigars available at the lowest prices on the planet!

alec bradley medalist is mellower than other cigars in the brand’s portfolio thanks to a unique shade-grown honduran wrapper and a balanced core of nicaraguan and honduran long-fillers underneath. a hint of citrus blesses the palate while woody notes of vanilla, nuts, and leather layer the taste buds with a mix of sweet and spicy flavor. a creamy and easygoing finish characterizes an old-school alec bradley blend in a collection of thick and popular shapes. save big on a classic from alec bradley that’s been around more than decade and a half and add medalist to your cigar collection today.

alec bradley maxx cigars offer complex flavor and aroma in a series of big-ring sizes that burn cool and slow for fans of fat cigars. an oily nicaraguan wrapper surrounds an intricate blend of premium long-filler tobaccos from colombia, costa rica, honduras, nicaragua, and the san andrés region in mexico. tasting notes of earth, cedar, and hickory mingle over a toasty and spicy foundation throughout a creamy, medium-bodied smoke. maxx cigars have been around for nearly two decades, and they’ve earned a few accolades in that time, including a 91-point rating from cigar aficionado. add alec bradley maxx cigars to your stash when you’re in search of budget-friendly boxes that are handmade in chunky sizes.

following in the footsteps of top-rated smokes like the 96-rated alec bradley prensado and the 94-rated alec bradley family blend, brand founder alan rubin delivers magic toast. this small-batch, honduran-drafted gem is named for a toast the fellas at ab shared when they raised their whiskey glasses and clinked them together to celebrate perfecting the cigar’s blend down in honduras. a medium-bodied profile of cocoa, wood, and cinnamon is drawn from a recipe of nicaraguan and honduran long-fillers beneath an oily, ultra-dark-brown honduran wrapper leaf. choose from a handful of classic sizes and add alec bradley magic toast to your coolerdor today.

alec bradley lineage cigars are handmade in honduras in a handful of popular sizes. an oily, medium-brown honduran wrapper leaf conceals premium nicaraguan and honduran long-filler tobaccos from head to foot. alec bradley lineage was originally conceived by brand founder alan rubin as a follow-up to his top-rated family blend line. lineage delivers a succulent profile of earth, caramel, and pepper throughout a toasty finish. anticipate consistent taste and creamy aroma with a flawless burn from the first puff to the last. add a 90-rated box of alec bradley lineage cigars to your collection for a budget-friendly bargain from your pals at holt’s.

alec bradley kintsugi cigars are named for the 15th century japanese artform of restoring broken pottery and making it beautiful again despite its imperfections. kintsugi is drafted from a cuban-seed honduran wrapper over a complex blend of nicaraguan and honduran long-fillers. the critics in cigar aficionado ranked alec bradley kintsugi in their annual ‘top 25’ for 2021 with a 92-point rating. tasting notes of cinnamon, espresso bean, and hazelnut layer the palate in a medium-bodied finish punctuated by hints of leather and sweetness. indulge in a collection of classic sizes with another honduran gem from alec bradley.

data.cigar_name: alec bradley it's a boy / it's a girl
data.cigar_description: what better way to enjoy the arrival of a newborn child than to light up and celebrate with your family and friends. alec bradley produces some of the top cigars on the market and has now released its very own it's a boy/it's a girl cigar to commemorate your brand new addition. the real kick here is that the decorative boxes come with a picture frame attached to the box top to let you continue the celebration of your newest family member.

a slew of 90+ ratings and a ‘#1 cigar of the year’ title from cigar aficionado precedes the alec bradley brand. alec bradley gatekeeper is a fresh take on brand founder alan rubin’s past success as his sons (and the namesake of his brand), alec and bradley, release another cigar of their own. an ecuador habano wrapper hugs a smooth amalgam of dominican and nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos in a handful of popular shapes. the limited edition blend delivers a medium-bodied profile of chestnuts, cedar, leather, and spices. alec bradley gatekeeper is handmade in the dominican republic by celebrated boutique cigar-maker ernesto perez-carrillo.

alec bradley family blend is a lovely, 94-rated gem. handmade in honduras, these beauties boast butterscotch-hued honduran wrappers, indonesian binders and a balanced blend of honduran and nicaraguan tobaccos. medium-bodied in strength, these cigars possess a rich, earthy flavor-core paired with nuances of leather, wood and toast. a smooth and satisfying cigar all the way through, this one is another winner from alec bradley.

alec bradley double broadleaf is the latest extension in the brand’s experimental series. double broadleaf is handcrafted in honduras from a hearty blend of connecticut-seed tobaccos grown in honduras, including its dark and decadent wrapper. a robust marriage of nicaraguan and honduran long-fillers completes the recipe. the brand’s new foray into honduran broadleaf tobaccos reveals malty notes of dark chocolate and cedar with a strong foundation of espresso bean, coffee, and a good amount of black pepper. a dense and toasty finish layers the palate with hints of salt and earth. add a beefy and unique broadleaf smoke to your rotation from alec bradley today.

alec bradley connecticut cigars are handmade in honduras in a collection of traditional sizes blended from a golden-blond connecticut-seed wrapper, grown in ecuador, and a vintage amalgam of premium nicaraguan and honduran long-filler tobaccos. tasting notes of cedar, cashew, and coffee bean layer the palate with hints of pecan and pepper before a mellow to medium-bodied finish resonates. add a box of 90-rated alec bradley connecticut cigars to your collection when you’re craving a budget-friendly, easygoing smoke you can enjoy any time of the day.

alec bradley blind faith cigars represent the first release blended by brand founder alan rubin’s sons, alec and bradley, for whom the company is named. the two brothers have grown up in the cigar business as their father built alec bradley into a national brand over the past two decades. today, they help run the company with their father and are now involved in the cigar-blending process. blind faith is the first official cigar created by alec and bradley following years of exposure to the tradition and technique that go into making premium cigars. blind faith is handmade in honduras in a collection of classic shapes drafted from a reddish-brown honduran wrapper leaf over a solid core of nicaraguan and honduran long-filler tobaccos. peppery notes of nuts, earth, and leather coat the palate in a meaty, medium-bodied profile before a savory finish arrives. taste how far the apple falls from the tree as alan rubin’s sons make their mark with their first signature cigar.

alec bradley black market estelí delivers rewarding flavor and a remarkable room note in a handful of classic, cool-burning shapes. a toothy nicaraguan wrapper leaf blankets a full-bodied recipe of nicaraguan and honduran tobaccos designed to please alec bradley fans from head to toe. taste a toasted, earthy profile of cocoa and spices with hints of white pepper and smoked hickory. as the head of alec bradley, alan rubin crafts a deep portfolio of smokes with plenty of complexity and richness.

alec bradley black market cigars are handcrafted by the plasencia family in honduras for alec bradley brand founder alan rubin. a dark and oily nicaraguan wrapper leaf conceals an ecuador binder over a complex blend of long-filler tobaccos from honduras and panama. tasting notes of smoked hickory and nuts layer the palate with hints of espresso, cocoa, and pepper before a lingering but balanced finish. alec bradley black market is rated 94 points by the critics in cigar aficionado and was ranked in the ‘top 10 cigars of the year’ for 2022.

alec bradley american sun grown cigars hail from estelí, nicaragua, where they’re patiently assembled in a collection of classic sizes. a deep, dark, and oily sun grown nicaraguan wrapper leaf marries a beefy blend of premium nicaraguan long-fillers from head to foot. the critics in cigar aficionado bestowed a 91-point rating on the american sun grown blend for its medium to full-bodied profile of leather, earth, and nuts with substantial spice and a hint of sweetness. add a box of consistent, value-priced alec bradley cigars to your coolerdor without breaking the bank when you introduce american sun grown into your regular rotation.

alec bradley american classic is an affordably priced cigar that exhibits perfect construction and wonderful flavor. it's comprised of a delicious medley of all-nicaraguan core components that are enrobed in a pristine, silky connecticut shade-grown wrapper from honduras. american classic starts out light and smooth with a bit of earthy, woodsy notes and picks up strength and complexity as you smoke it.
